content.content: March Executive Proposals - Hat moved in support of current Executive Passed on Mar 26 2022 17:32 UTC. Executed on Mar 28 2022 17:33 UTC.  Authorizing the ESM on DssFlash and Adding Support for TUSD Implementation - March 25, 2022  If this executive proposal passes, the following changes will occur within the Maker Protocol:  The Emergency Shutdown Module will be authorized to revoke Governance control over the Flash Mint Module (DssFlash) after an Emergency Shutdown.  If this executive proposal passes, the following additions will be made to the Maker Protocol:  Support for the new TUSD implementation contract (0xd8D59c59Ab40B880b54C969920E8d9172182Ad7b), which will allow collateral operations of TUSD-A to resume.  Governing Proposal Supported having proceeded properly through the governance process, and I have no special objection.  Curve stETH-ETH Onboarding, Rate Limited Flapper, Immunefi Bug Bounty Payouts - March 11, 2022  If this executive proposal passes, the following changes and additions will occur within the Maker Protocol:  Curve stETH-ETH LP tokens will be onboarded as a new collateral to the Maker Protocol as the CRVV1ETHSTETH-A vault type, parameters listed below. A new rate limiter, detailed below, will be added to the flapper contract. A total of 2,750 DAI will be transferred to two addresses, detailed below, as part of the Immunefi Bug Bounty Program.  Governing Proposal Supported having proceeded properly through the governance process, and I have no special objection.  Mitigate Post-Shutdown Flash Loan Vulnerability - March 9, 2022  This out-of-schedule executive proposal mitigates the post-shutdown flash loan vulnerability in the Maker Protocol as described by the Protocol Engineering Core Unit here. Note that there is no risk to Maker Protocol or any of its stakeholders so long as Emergency Shutdown has not been triggered. Voting for this executive proposal will place your MKR in support of the changes and additions outlined above. Unless otherwise noted, the changes and additions listed above are subject to the GSM Pause Delay. This means that if this executive proposal passes, the changes and additions listed above will only become active in the Maker Protocol after the GSM Pause Delay has expired. The GSM Pause Delay is currently set to 48 hours. Governing Proposal Supported having proceeded properly through the governance process, and I have no special objection.  Core Unit Budget Distributions, Recognized Delegate Compensation, MOMC Parameter Changes - March 4, 2022  If this executive proposal passes, the following outcomes will be executed:  A total of 397,184 Dai (itemized below) will be transferred to multiple Core Units. A total of 5,747,562 Dai (itemized below) will be streamed to multiple Core Units. The existing DAI budget stream for the Risk Core Unit will be revoked. A total of 57,665 DAI (itemized below) will be transferred to eight Recognized Delegates as part of the Delegate Compensation Trial.  If this executive proposal passes, the following changes will occur within the Maker Protocol:  Parameter changes (detailed below) from the latest proposal from the MakerDAO Open Market Committee, including Maximum Debt Ceiling increases, Target Available Debt increases, and a Target Borrow Rate decrease.  Governing Proposal Supported having proceeded properly through the governance process, and I have no special objection.

content.content: Weekly Summary: April 7-14, 2022 Polling Votes 2 Polls - Ended Apr 07 2022 16:00 UTC PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - April 4, 2022 Small Stability Fee decreases on multiple vault types, Aave D3M Target Borrow Rate increase, Debt Ceiling increases on GUNIV3DAIUSDC vault types, and other minor changes. Voted - NO - Included the following comment onchain:   We are in a rising interest rate environment! I am not convinced by the framing of what is competition for us requiring this loss in revenue.   My objection was only to this part of the Poll “Small Stability Fee decreases on multiple vault types”, the other changes I am in agreement with. I moved my hat to support the subsequent Executive that included all of the Polled elements.   Launch Maker Wormhole With Optimism and Arbitrum Domains - April 4, 2022 Signal your support or opposition to launching Maker Wormhole and approving Gateways for the Optimism and Arbitrum Domains, allowing Fast DAI Withdrawals. Voted - YES - Included the following comment onchain:  WAGMI   No brainer. Excellent work, Team. Very excited to see this go live!  1 Poll - Ended Apr 14 2022 16:00 UTC Adjust CRVV1ETHSTETH-A System Parameters - April 11, 2022 Signal your support or opposition to increasing the Maximum Debt Ceiling and Target Available Debt for the CRVV1ETHSTETH-A vault type. Voted - YES - stETH is the FUTURE!  I couldn’t be more supportive of scaling this vault as aggressively as is prudent, and inline with market demand.  2 Polls - Ending Apr 25 2022 16:00 UTC Ratification Poll for Adding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) - April 11, 2022 These subproposals onboard Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) whose mandate is to coordinate and execute MakerDAO branded events at Crypto/DEV Conference locations. Voted - YES - Included the following comment onchain:  We must have a large and saucy meat space presence around the world. The people here are what make MakerDAO so special at the end of the day. The future of all DAOs, DeFi and Web3 is going to hinge on the quality of the social bonds among people. We cannot neglect to empower this team for marketing and branding purposes, but also for ourselves. I was in Denver and although I did not attend the party, I saw how much it made everyone happy and eyes sparkle!! This sort of thing is 100% aligned with developing a “social token” investment thesis for MKR which I would like to see us all lean into.  In the Forum:    MIP39c2-SP32: Adding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) Formal Submission       I am voting in favor of adding the Events Core Unit.  I’ve been encouraging the community to look at the nascent sector of social tokens. We can add utility to MKR via its use for social access and belonging. Would this team be willing to research and incorporate these approaches into the events?  For example, MKR holders should be able to claim an exclusive event NFT they can show for admission to a VIP section of the event. Perks might be combined with event sponsors for free drinks. The sky i…         MIP39c2-SP32: Adding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) Formal Submission       To be clear, the leading communities have ERC20 membership tokens, which also are used directly to token-gate IRL events as well as their community portals and private Discord channels.     Ratification Poll for Methodology and Review Process for Structured Finance Transactions (MIP67) - April 11, 2022 MIP67 intends to formalise the methodology and high-level process to evaluate structured finance transactions made under the MIP6 application process. Voted - YES - I love TFW a colleague has so eloquently stated the reason to support a proposal that I can do no better than copy and past it here.  100% this, and especially appreciate the call out to prepare a process for small players and start ups.     Flip Flop Flap Delegate LLC Platform   Ratification Poll for Methodology and Review Process for Structured Finance Transactions (MIP67) - April 11, 2022 Voted “YES,” in support of a methodology that will implement checks and balances–a benchmark that will help attract quality borrowers and clarifies the necessary frameworks needed in order to onboard RWA collateral types. This framework will also help align and communicate to the world, the necessary requirements needed in order to become an RWA collateral type. We believe implementing a framework that hails MakerDAO as a senior secured lender with favorable rights for loan transactions. This will help the DAO determine what course of action it should take when a Default occurs. It will also help the RWF CU, incubating LOVE-01 CU, and proposed Legal CU create assessments that can determine if the MIP6 applicant has the ability to pay Stability Fees and principal under the terms of the legal/deal documents. Without an RWA methodology, we believe MakerDAO will not be taken serious as a Real World Lender. And because we believe that some digital asset will become global powerhouses, DAI must be showcased as a digital asset that has the ability to compete on the World’s stage. MIP67 will help real world financing companies understand the requirements needed in order to access DAI RWA Vaults, a powerful tool. It will also help showcase the current RWA Core Units team members years of experience in selecting the right projects, and structuring RWA deals in a correct manner. However, let’s not forget that MKR token owners will always have the final say. 3F Delegate is a proponent of implementing a secondary RWA Core Unit that will provide incoming RWA startups the ability to access the powerful tools of MakerDAO. This secondary Core Unit will inspired the next Generation MIP6 applicants to showcase themselves. Perhaps a former employee of a successful borrower who acquired the expertise and is now ready to explore uncharted waters. Such CU should follow a different Methodology that allows entrepreneurs the access and the freedom to perform lending best practices via Maker Vaults. After all, MakerDAO was built by taking-on Risk. And finally, we cannot begin to tell you how many times we have been ask by personal connections hailing from TradFi organizations, as to why MakerDAO is giving out risk-free loans? Some sounded baffled–as they proceeded to deviate from further discussing if MakerDAO is a serious lender. And it’s these misconception that can easily attract fraudulent borrowers. The MakerDAO community cannot afford to take on risks that it cannot afford. The off-chain world is opaque, and many borrowers are inexperienced. Defaults will happen. With a Surplus Buffer that allows this DAO to take minimal off-chain risk, there’s no viable reason why MIP67 should not be supported.

content.content: Weekly Summary: April 15-28, 2022 Polling Votes In an effort to find some relief from the administrative burden of preparing these summaries, I reduced the amount of information copy/pasted from the governance portal below and will draft a single paragraph(s) consolidating explanation for decisions taken. I appreciate the importance of timely communication by Recognized Delegates, so am working to find a happy balance of spending available time on the substance while also maintaining good records here! I look forward to the work we are doing as a community to better clarify and establish a common understanding of the Delegate role and/or the specific modes and views that distinguish how each of us approaches the responsibilities. My approach to date has been to observe as much as possible without participating in debate unless I have a specific question, concern or point of view I feel strongly about expressing in a particular context. This accords with my tendency to vote toward the very end of any allowable window, which gives me the best view of community perspectives. I believe my role as Recognized Delegate includes overwhelming support for the efforts and contributions of our Core Units and Mandated Actors, unless removed or to the extent sanctions or reprimand result through a community agreed process. I have a responsibly to be an optimistic and enthusiastic champion of our collective success, not a naysayer. I will not hesitate to go against popular opinion or bluntly state my objections. But at the end of the day I view myself as a servant of the DAO (not just MKR holders) which requires I evaluate decisions with deference to others where appropriate and not just based on my particular view of the world. You all deserve to know my crypto political and policy views so you can assess how I’m likely to vote and engage around the very important conversations we are having about the future of the DAO, as well as, how best to navigate in the short-term. In brief: I drank all the Web3 kool-aide. And why not? I left WallStreetistan for a reason. So far, after 6 years in crypto I can honestly say there’s no better place to apply belief (and hope!) than MakerDAO. My votes below reflect the trust I have in this incredible community. The people who have proposed budgets know better than I do what they need for their time and to accomplish their mandates. I am very concerned that non of you feel unappreciated and unseen! There is no one here who is getting paid enough in pure dollars today to compensate for the opportunity cost of your life, time and talent pursuing this wild endeavor. We are still at such an experimental stage with no idea really where exactly this goes, or how to get there. But if you are reading this, you probably feel something strongly that you can’t see. Thus humility in all we do is crucial, but we must lean in and especially now during a most turbulent time ahead. 2 POLLS - ENDED APR 21 2022 16:00 UTC  Short Ratification Poll to Amend MIP64 to allow more flexibility in scope (MIP4c3-SP3) - April 18, 2022 Voted - YES  Whitelist Oasis.app on Multiple Oracles (MIP10c9-SP30) - April 18, 2022 Voted - YES 10 POLLS - ENDED APR 25 2022 16:00 UTC (see prior post for additional 2 polls ending on this date but voted earlier ACREinvest Delegate Platform - #13 by ACREinvest)  Ratification Poll for Governance Communications Core Unit, COM-001, Mandate Refresh (MIP39c2-SP30) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Dissolution of Content Production, MKT-001, Multi-Sig Request (MIP47c3-SP1) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Modify Protocol Engineering Core Unit Budget, PE-001 (MIP40c3-SP68) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Add Data Insights Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP64) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP62) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP63) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Adding CES-001 as a Collateral Onboarding Domain Team - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Modify the Collateral Application Form (MIP6c3-SP2) - April 11, 2022 Voted - YES  Ratification Poll for Pairwyse Licensure (MIP66) - April 11, 2022. Community Greenlight Poll - IPCL (India Power Green Bonds) - May 2, 2022 (thread) Voted: No (Defer) MIP6 Collateral Onboarding: India Power Green Bonds - #19 by ACREinvest  Thank you for the presentation and conversation this week. My high level take away is that your team is looking to MakerDAO for education and to determine for you key commercial terms of both deals. This is not our role. I am not enthusiastic about diverting the precious time and resources of our CUs to comb through all of this information without there being a pre-diligenced and comprehensive term sheet, structure, etc. etc. proposed for us to react to. content.content: Please see below for a summary of Polling Votes cast from May 18 - 25, 2022. If “Reasoning” is provided, this means comments were posted on-chain with the vote. For votes below in favor of raising the ESM minimum threshold and adjusting the lid parameter on the rate limited flapper, ultimately I was persuaded these adjustments were in the best interest of the protocol’s security and prudent risk management. In this update I’d like to briefly share a few items to provide some color on what’s standing out as core concerns from my perspective as a Delegate at ACREinvest. Each of the linked comments and proposals below illustrate extremely valid critiques and potential solutions for the challenges facing MakerDAO today. We urgently need to empower a DAO-wide/overall-DAO full-time executive function separate from, but integrated with CUs. This group must have specific domain expertise and credentialed experience unlocked through both a delegation of responsibility approved by MKR holder vote and adequate compensation/incentives. I am not convinced this should be work undertaken by Delegates or MKR holders (per se). Without adding bureaucracy and operational complexity, there needs to be someone(s) in charge of the big picture who can operate transparently and with complete disclosures regarding actual and potential conflicts of interest. Who (i.e., what kind of actor) is in the best position of trust to be responsible for understanding everything that’s happening and capable to communicate the information legibly to the various stakeholders in the MakerDAO ecosystem (not just MKR holders)? We must achieve consensus on the answer quickly to maintain the legitimacy necessary to reach our full potential, while also remaining a pioneer in how an open, permissionless decentralized organizational structure in DeFi can work at scale. Food for thought:     The MKR holder Confessional Miscellaneous       Why I sold my MKR  After thinking long and hard I sold my stack of MKR several months ago. This post came as a good opportunity to explain why.  The initial design  As most of you know MakerDAO is one of the very first DAOs, with a initial design dating back to the start of Ethereum. Having such ancient DNA does however come with a cost - all the functions that since DeFi summer started can be found in other protocols had to be designed into Maker from the start. This naturally led to a very bro…     This subtweet I take to be about us by Recognized Delegate @Hasu - valid!  twitter.com    Hasu⚡️🤖 @hasufl  You can "govern in public" all you want but if you have a mix between  1) low-quality delegates (due to low incentivization / no quality control) 2) low governance participation (so suppliers can meaningfully vote their own deals) then you are fucked anyway   2:35 PM - 23 May 2022           180                16                Investment Committee Work / food for thought Miscellaneous       Nice. Always thoughtful. I appreciate the time and effort to draw an analogy to a structure familiar in finance. Rather than blithely tearing up the playbook, we should always be looking toward precedent/history for lessons as to how to best design systems.  Ultimately, the efficacy of a system lies in in the incentives embedded within it. You detail several components of an effective IC (Independent participants, personal skin in the game, performance feedback etc.) which will be instructive fo…         Real World Finance: Decision-Making and Delegated Committee Proposal Real World Finance       Summary  This post introduces a decision-making methodology for real world assets after collateral on-boarding.  Based on that methodology, this post includes a proposal to delegate some decision-making to a committee of volunteers approved by MKR token holders. Go to the section “PROPOSAL” for details.   In anticipation of risk assessments for SG Forge and HVB being published soonest, @eumenes and @christiancdpetersen are providing to the Forum a modified version of their presentation of May 4,…     Raise the ESM Minimum Threshold - May 16, 2022 (thread](Mimecast TTP Web Portal)) Voted: Yes Adjust the lid Parameter on the Rate Limited Flapper - May 16, 2022 (thread](Mimecast TTP Web Portal)) Voted: Yes Ratification Poll for Monetalis Clydesdale, Liquid Bond Strategy & Execution (MIP65) - May 9, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We stand at a crossroad. Will this community evolve to allow a meritocracy of transparent governance that resists centralized power and coercive tactics by those who would seek to capture the value and potential of this DAO for a small group of insiders? ACREinvest votes no on both Monetalis proposals which outsource for significant rents many of the same functions we have already painstakingly designed and resourced for internally via Core Units. The approval of this poll reflects a poor choice for how to optimize our current pole position, talent pool and resources for maximum effect in the rapidly innovating realm of DeFi and ReFi (regenerative finance). For further commentary, see updates to the ACREinvest Delegate Platform post on the Forum this coming week. Ratification Poll for Monetalis Lusitano, UK Green Economy SME Wholesale Lending (MIP68) - May 9, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We stand at a crossroad. Will this community evolve to allow a meritocracy of transparent governance that resists centralized power and coercive tactics by those who would seek to capture the value and potential of this DAO for a small group of insiders? ACREinvest votes no on both Monetalis proposals which outsource for significant rents many of the same functions we have already painstakingly designed and resourced for internally via Core Units. The approval of this poll reflects a poor choice for how to optimize our current pole position, talent pool and resources for maximum effect in the rapidly innovating realm of DeFi and ReFi (regenerative finance). For further commentary, see updates to the ACREinvest Delegate Platform post on the Forum this coming week. Ratification Poll for L2-to-L1 Fast Withdrawals (MIP69) - May 9, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Very happy to support this kind of upgrade which is inline with promoting MakerDAO as core DeFi settlement and transaction infrastructure. Ratification Poll for MIP40 Budget Process Amendment (MIP4c2-SP19) - May 9, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: The budget process absolutely needs this overhaul given the scale of our operations. The additional pain in the short term should have the beneficial effect of helping CUs achieve their business goals. Ratification Poll for Strategic Happiness (SH-001) Core Unit Budget Modification (MIP40c3-SP67) - May 9, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: ACREinvest votes no due to the proposal not meeting the standards of professionalism and accountability necessary for a Core Unit. Even after many revisions and especially in light of current market conditions, the requested budget is not fiscally prudent without being closely integrated with an overall marketing and strategic plan (that may best be managed and executed cooperatively by multiple CUs). Community Greenlight Poll - FEI (Fei USD) - May 16, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes (Greenlight) Reasoning: Very supportive of this opportunity to support Tribe DAO and build ecosystem resiliency among natively decentralized protocols and communities. This proposal makes a positive contribution to advancing organic DAI growth as discussed in A North Star - DAI as the Destination - a strategic consideration important for the longer-term view. Investigate Implementation of an Antalpha Institutional Vault - May 23, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes (Greenlight) Reasoning: Happy to see us expand IV with this strong counterparty, but please do consider how we might implement with a larger number of vaults of lower value per vault. Investigate Deploying the MakerDAO Balance Sheet in ETH - May 23, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Having fixed costs denominated in ETH is quite a valid reason to have some ETH. Sized correctly and with regular small purchases (DCA) would be important for implementation - we do not want to speculate on the price in the short term. This is not turning us into fund managers, but rather better aligning our overall performance with ether’s long-term upside ROI that we certainly should hold as a base case. Launch Maker Teleport with 1 Basis Point Fee - May 23, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: There is no free lunch. Someone always pays. It should be the customers and not us. Failure to recoup any costs from launch is a form of taking losses rather than generating some income as thoughtfully proposed here where we can be both competitive and adaptable to changing market conditions in the future.

content.content: ACREinvest voted in favor of the Urgent Executive to Temporarily Disable the Aave DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) - June 15, 2022 Decrease the Target Borrow Rate (bar) of the Aave D3M to 0, this will unwind the Aave D3M vault. On-Chain Vote Comments: I expect we are heading into a terrible storm and absolutely should not risk the potential hit if MakerDAO failed to take this action today. Thank you to the community members who raised this issue and organized for swift action. ACREinvest is also pleased to send a signal to the market that we are serious risk managers and can be trusted to make the hard calls quickly and early when it counts. We voted YES on yesterday’s Urgent Signal Request and posted this comment there:     URGENT: Signal Request Set Aave D3M bar to 0% Signal Requests       I totally agree and appreciate this comment. However, the banks were correct. The system was insolvent and not trustworthy. On September 15, 2008 I still had a job at Lehman Brothers, but in Europe there was no money transferred overnight because of the credit freeze, so they all went home that day. In North America we lived long enough to get bought by Barclays. By September 22, 2008 I worked for Barclays… until I didn’t.  I vote yes. Let’s not hesitate to act aggressively right now to protect…

content.content: Summary of Polling Votes cast June 3 - 15, 2022. Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Voting yes here is a big reversal. ACREinvest until now has consistently signaled and polled no on burning MKR. In light of market conditions and challenges for the months to come, I favor supporting the views of a large part of the community regarding the burn at this time. You could say I’m placing a new premium on compromise that boosts unity and morale where the trade off is controlled and appropriately risk-managed. I am comfortable with this trial given the limited scope as proposed here and, importantly, in light of recent liquidations increasing the SB over the past few days… plus, the technological experimentation is attractive. Given the brutal price action across the crypto ecosystem, an open market buy of MKR would be a very powerful signal now whether or not in the ordinary course the burn makes sense as part of normal operations.     [Signal Request] Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation & Resurrect the Burn Signal Requests       I very much respect that the burn is a very important part of MakerDAO for many members of the community. Framing this finance issue in terms of a social contract is interesting and a concept I struggle with on two fronts.  One: How does a social contract evolve as a DAO scales, becomes more decentralized and needs to onboard large numbers of new stakeholders to thrive?  Two: If one believes the economic impact does not match the lore of the burn, is it appropriate to continue for emotional reas…     Management of Velodrome Airdrop and veNFT - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Excited about this project and appreciate these suggestions to assist the community until we have a more active metagovernance process in place to support the partnership.     [Signal Request] Incoming Velodrome Airdrop on Optimism - $VELO veNFT Signal Requests       This is sooooo exciting! I am very interested in assisting with the active governance of this on behalf of MakerDAO so we do not have to rely on the Velodrome team. Would the community support a metaGovernance proposal from ACREinvest and anyone in particular have capacity to help me with a proposal?     Add rETH as a new Vault Type - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: ACREinvest cannot support adding to the backlog at this time with increased exposure to a staked ETH product in the current environment. Also cautious due to the current specter of contagion from failure/insolvency of large forced sellers across the ecosystem. Very happy to revisit once the dust settles, and hope to see a better ROI picture at that time given the resources that would be required to onboard and sustain the vault.

content.content: NEWS: ACREinvest has submitted a proposal for Kianga Daverington to serve as Interim Chief Legal Officer of MakerDAO for a limited period of 6 months via a MIP55 Special Purpose Fund. View the proposal and community discussion here: MIP55c3-SP5: Interim Chief Legal Officer Summary of Executive & Polling Votes cast June 16 - 22, 2022 Community Greenlight Poll - KREDIKA (Kredika LTD) - June 6, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: I like the proposal, but from a timing and internal resources perspective do not want to add this to the cue until we have cleared the deck of deals near completion. Also key to my decision is the need to reserve capacity for the heightened credit and market risk review that’s required across our current book. Until there is a better picture of the impact on our business and partners from the unfolding blowups and defaults, MakerDAO needs to focus on current obligations and existing relationships. Community Greenlight Poll - XSGD (StraitsX) - June 6, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: I very much support expanding the stablecoin collateral base of the protocol to other national currencies. How best to do that and when will take a significant amount of investigation and focused work. Accordingly, I repeat the need to reserve capacity for the heightened credit and market risk review that’s required across our current book. Until there is a better picture of the impact on our business and partners from the unfolding blowups and defaults, MakerDAO needs to focus on current obligations and existing relationships. Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment - June 6, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Abstain Reasoning: Please see my comments on the Forum explaining why I abstain https://forum.makerdao.com/t/prioritization-framework-sentiment-polling/15554/29?u=acreinvest Prioritization Sentiment - Collateral Class - June 6, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Abstain Reasoning: Please see my comments on the Forum explaining why I abstain https://forum.makerdao.com/t/prioritization-framework-sentiment-polling/15554/29?u=acreinvest Active Polls 11 POLLS - ENDING JUN 27 2022 16:00 UTC Reasoning provided with on-chain comments: All 11 of my poll votes today are cast as a resounding YES to the proposals and budget increases, as applicable. Please see my follow-up Delegate Platform post for specific reflections on each poll. But overall, why? Penny wise, Pound foolish is a warning my mother used to utter. I applaud every person in this community who has taken the initiative to express a vision and plan for actions. Now is the moment to empower them with a vote of trust to be excellent stewards of resources and their responsibilities. I trust they will all remain accountable to Governance and have the intention, integrity and intelligence to adjust budgets and priorities as appropriate where needed. We are heading into a period of unprecedented destruction. The fate of many generations will be determined by what each of us does right now. The people working for MakerDAO in Core Units and Mandated Actors are the army we have in place to meet this moment. They are the best in the business and best-in-class. We should not take them for granted. We cannot replace them, nor should we. We need their loyalty and enthusiasm to ensure DAI is available to re-liquify the world when the dust settles. No one has better information right now than the people who have stepped up via these proposals to move this organization forward. The governance checks in place are entirely sufficient to course correct or address unforeseen problems with the execution of these mandates. Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to IS-001 - @psychonaut (MIP41c4-SP34) - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Additional Comments: I appreciate Joshua’s consistent presence and initiative he is taking to contribute more to MakerDAO. With community support I’m sure he can do very well in this role and work constructively to revise the CU structure or mandate if that makes sense in the future. Travin’s recommendation was an important positive factor in this determination. MIP41c4-SP34: Immunefi Security Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - IS-001 - #17 by TravinImmunefi Ratification Poll for Facilitator Onboarding to DIN-001 - @tadeo (MIP41c4-SP35) - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Additional Comments: Tadeo is doing terrific work for the DAO and I believe he will do a great job bringing more needed visibility to the work of this CU and assist in integrating its products in ways that will benefit the ecosystem even more. Ratification Poll for Adding Lending Oversight Core Unit (LOVE-001) - June 13, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Additional Comments: Luca brings tremendous understanding and capabilities in crucial growth areas for MakerDAO. Ratification Poll for Task Forces (MIP75) - June 13, 2022. This is a conservative proposal to begin and we must. Talent is too constrained under the status quo. content.content: DAVERINGTON HOUSE RULES When I joined MakerDAO in December 2021 as a Recognized Delegate, the vibez were impeccable. My first contact was @prose11 who demontrated incredible warmth, friendliness and patience as I truly struggled to navigate the Forum for even the most basic information. Immediately, as soon as I published this Delegate Platform, @PaperImperium reached out with another warm welcome and invited me to join the Delegates chat group. All the other current Delegates at that time extended themselves and expressed enthusiasm for my joining their ranks. I thank you all and am so grateful for your continuing support! The Delegate chat is a place of informal banter and conversation. It was invaluable for me as a total outsider to have a small group I could relate with directly and learn a ton by osmosis. Plus, everyone was super helpful by answering questions or providing information to assist my getting up to speed. What also struck me at the time in those first months among OGs and newer Delegates was how collegial everyone is! There were disagreements absolutely and some clashes of opinion. But no matter how passionate the exchange, everyone always maintained respect. I never once detected that disagreements became personal attacks, or in any way compromised our ability to operate independently, yet still feel a sense of comradeship given our shared caring for this project. @MakerMan Don’t go!!! Announcement - At end of term MakerMan will be retiring as a delegate. The weekly G&R (Governance and Risk) calls were also quite fun. @Davidutro used to que amazing mood music as we gathered and more people attended with their cameras on than do today. Ah,  today… Something has radically shifted in the culture and quality of community interactions. Many people are speaking about it, thinking about it and feeling it. Now I am a liberty minded person, so I don’t like being told what to do and I try to refrain from telling others how they should think, behave and, most importantly, what they should value or believe. I am a die hard for VOLUNTARISM and FREEDOM OF ASSOCIATION. I hope I am a very tolerant person. I think my professional and personal life shows I can get along really well with all KINDS of people. But at the end of the day, let each person police themselves (or not) and let others chose to associate (or not). Simple, really. In the wider Web3 and DAO space, we are struggling greatly with how to have open communities with low barriers to entry and no “gate-keeping,” but that otherwise maintain healthy relationships among the participants, so we can work productively (and enjoyably!) together. A lot of communities are creating Codes of Conduct like this one at SEED CLUB: Snapshot I’m a $CLUB holder. I signed it. I think it’s totes fine that’s how SEED CLUB rolls. They (it/we?) are trying to protect who they (we) are and what we want to achieve together. However, if I were a co-founder of a new tokenized community (oh wait, I am!) I don’t think this approach aligns with some of my personal core values, but I have no inner conflict about agreeing and accepting the rules any community sets for participation in principle. I voluntarily choose to associate with the community, and these are the rules. >>> I <<< accept. That was easy. Accordingly, I have no issue with abiding by the SEED CLUB Code of Conduct, but honestly (between you and me) it probably does dampen my enthusiasm a little. I don’t think it’s possible to mandate “safe spaces” and the attempt to do so probably has the opposite effect in practice. I really appreciate this proposal by Recognized Delegate @Hasu and do support the creation of a non-scientific document that specifies what MakerDAO is here to do, why and how. Simple MakerDAO — Governance from first principles - #58 by Miguel_Cabeza One urgent issue we don’t spend enough time on at MakerDAO is the social/human dynamic of what we do here and how. I believe membership in the Council should have requirements about reputation and character that demonstrate members have sufficient EQ to understand and support the most sophisticated and advanced technology asset we have here - the HUMAN SPIRIT.  What is emotional intelligence or EQ? Emotional intelligence (otherwise known as emotional quotient or EQ) is the ability to understand, use, and manage your own emotions in positive ways to relieve stress, communicate effectively, empathize with others, overcome challenges and defuse conflict. Emotional intelligence helps you build stronger relationships, succeed at school and work, and achieve your career and personal goals. It can also help you to connect with your feelings, turn intention into action, and make informed decisions about what matters most to you. Emotional intelligence is commonly defined by four attributes:   Self-management – You’re able to control impulsive feelings and behaviors, manage your emotions in healthy ways, take initiative, follow through on commitments, and adapt to changing circumstances.  Self-awareness – You recognize your own emotions and how they affect your thoughts and behavior. You know your strengths and weaknesses, and have self-confidence.  Social awareness – You have empathy. You can understand the emotions, needs, and concerns of other people, pick up on emotional cues, feel comfortable socially, and recognize the power dynamics in a group or organization.  Relationship management – You know how to develop and maintain good relationships, communicate clearly, inspire and influence others, work well in a team, and manage conflict.   I’m supportive of a new effort to create a community/MKR holder ratified constitution-like document, but this should NOT be a Code of Conduct or set of rules for community member behavior. Instead, I have what I think is a novel approach in today’s culture. I am going to set my own personal code of conduct.  These are Daverington House Rules. They apply to the individual writing this post (Kianga Daverington) and do not apply to any other person or business entity. As long as I speak and act for ACREinvest here, however, it will pertain to how ACREinvest shows up in community meetings and conversations. Anyone is free to associate with me or not based on my personal code of conduct. I welcome anyone pointing out when/if my actions in the community violate my own Daverington House Rules and to take whatever actions he/she/they find appropriate. If you’ve read this far and still don’t know why I am adopting this personal code of conduct. Let me be succinct: The quality of human interaction at MakerDAO is devolving. Should this continue I believe it will be fatal to the organization. No software upgrade, token incentives or restructuring is going to save it. Since I cannot control anyone else (and do not want to), I must consider what it is that I CAN do. The DAVERINGTON HOUSE RULES can be simply stated as: Two strikes and I’m out!  If Kianga Daverington is attending a community meeting or engaged in an async conservation and observes any of the below Offending Behaviors according to her exclusive determination of the matter,   she will raise an objection in writing or verbally once… twice… and if the Offending Behavior against anyone or group in that meeting or conversation continues, Ms. Daverington will end the meeting (if she is the host) or she will leave the meeting/conversation if merely a participant. “Offending Behavior” means any of the following:    Psychological Operations designed to manipulate through deflection, gas-lighting, projection or other covert tactics Grand Standing Excessive Rudeness Personal attacks directed to anyone participating in such meeting or conversation (or not present) Trolling (especially in writing in the chat during live meetings when people are having a verbal discussion)   The next ACREinvest Delegate Office Hours will take place on Wed, July 6 at 15:00 EST | 19:00 UTC and the topic of discussion will be our MIP55 proposal MIP55c3-SP5: Interim Chief Legal Officer Kianga Daverington is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting. Topic: Avoiding the Tragedy: ACREinvest Delegate Office Hours Time: Jul 6, 2022 03:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada) Join Zoom Meeting   Zoom Video   Join our Cloud HD Video Meeting Zoom is the leader in modern enterprise video communications, with an easy, reliable cloud platform for video and audio conferencing, chat, and webinars across mobile, desktop, and room systems. Zoom Rooms is the original software-based conference... content.content: Withdrawal of MIP55c3-SP5: Interim Chief Legal Officer Since submitting the above proposal on June 22, 2022 a number of developments internally and externally as of yesterday have resulted in my decision not to pursue a workforce role within MakerDAO. Thank you to all for your consideration and I look forward to being a participant in positive outcomes via other means. @Recognized-Delegates ACREinvest will continue to be an active voter on proposals under the Recognized Delegate program status quo, and will evaluate our engagement in the future relative to any modifications that may be proposed and passed by MKR holders. The core reason for this decision is the realization that MakerDAO has become, or reverted to, what I call “RuneDAO” which is an untenable situation in which to consider working full-time for MakerDAO. I’ve given a number of speeches and rants on the subject in many places, so there’s no a lot more to say in this post other than to summarize and collect the issues here for ease of reference: Internal: MakerDAO appears to be captured and entirely controlled by its Founder. A brief dynamic period of flourishing openness and organic decentralization of decision making appears to be over. Reasons for this conclusion: Excellent analysis of MakerDAO governance here by @luca_pro # 43 | First Principles of Crypto Governance This new analysis of MKR wallets is also instructive:     MKR Token Decentralization Views Strategic Finance   MKR Token Decentralization Views Commentary on data as of July 14, 2022 (embedded views will auto refresh with updated data). All views exclude Maker-owned addresses that hold MKR. Addresses known to be owned by a single entity are lumped together. Unless otherwise specified, views only include addresses/entities with at least 1 MKR token.  One aspect of decentralization in the DAO is how decentralized the MKR token is, as it represents governance power. For this reason, we put together some me…     Most persuasive, however, has been the practical need for the community to capitulate to the Founder’s domination of conversation and DAO resources as reflected by a couple conversations yesterday in Discord. Screen shots are attached below for those who do not frequent the main MakerDAO Discord server or follow this level of granularity in day-to-day governance. The imperative to view the Founder’s influence as controlling the day and dispositive of the success or failure of DAO contributors has spread to partners, potential partners and counterparties of the DAO, which I find particularly distressing. The conversation in RWF office hours on July 20, 2022 revealed this unfortunate reality, including an example of the many ways pressure is being brought to bear on everyone to reorient themselves to serve RuneDAO. I had some choice words about this entire dynamic that for completeness should also be referenced here. As soon as the recording is available, I will link it to this thread.  1EFF57BE-638E-42B5-89C9-19D9C2DC206E1536×2048 185 KB   F1554EEB-E2F3-4A96-8D05-E11DEC7AAC4B1536×2048 270 KB   47CE8EEA-D574-4F4A-B5E7-A02D4A5AB9D21536×2048 247 KB   C48186EC-DCF8-480B-84EA-CDDD68730BA51536×2048 226 KB   F8C65161-EAD3-4300-BE82-AEEA6699BB211536×2048 251 KB  As one can plainly deduce from the conversations, there is becoming (and planned for) limited viability to actively engage in the governance of MakerDAO or fulfill Core Unit responsibilities unless one gives the Founder their full attention and deference. The above reflected state of affairs is problematic for a number or reasons. When considering providing legal services in a leadership role at MakerDAO, recent external developments combined with the above radically diminishes the attractiveness of the opportunity (for any amount of money). External Clarity has greatly increased over the past 30 days from a regulatory/enforcement perspective as to how governance structures and the reality around who can and does influence outcomes for a project should be evaluated. See below for a few threads from Twitter worth a deep dive and my own summary high-level view on the matter.   twitter.com    Dane Lund 👽 @lund_dane  Today the DOJ and SEC brought actions against a former Coinbase employee, his brother, and his friend for allegedly trading ahead of listing announcements.  The SEC's action here is particularly relevant for securities analysis.  I will walk through the details here. 🧵   4:58 PM - 21 Jul 2022           83                15              twitter.com    Birdnals @BirdnalsLAW  Some quick thoughts on the SEC's action against an ex-Coinbase employee and others for selling "crypto asset securities" in violation of Section 10(b) of the Exchange Act [15 U.S.C. § 78j(b)] and Rule 10b-5 thereunder.  Complaint: sec.gov/litigation/com… 🧵   7:36 PM - 21 Jul 2022           41                20              twitter.com    Patrick Hansen @paddi_hansen  1/ Yesterday, after 2-3 years of consultation, discussion, amendments & negotiation, EU institutions reached an agreement on MiCA.  MiCA is probably the most important piece of crypto regulation to date.  Here is a brief overview of some key decisions 👇  europarl.europa.eu/news/en/press-…   10:14 AM - 1 Jul 2022           650                280              twitter.com    kianga.eth 🌍 1000 ACRE DAOs in 1000 Days @fhomoney  The calculation has become very easy.   A project that wants to preserve any measure of OG purity around permissionlessness and cypherpunk values MUST:  1) Operate as a “TRULY” decentralized network, and 2) Avoid global regulatory characterization as a security or stablecoin.   12:55 PM - 21 Jul 2022           2            In closing, the above in no way represents a legal conclusion or opinion on matters of law in any jurisdiction, nor the application of facts and circumstances at MakerDAO to any of these developments. The above is certainly not investment advice and does not express an opinion on whether MKR and the MakerDAO suite of products and services (however considered) are a good or bad investment for anyone in particular or in general. The above represents an individual and firm assessment of ACREinvest’s particular role in the community at MakerDAO at this time, and the DeFi/Web3 community at large who we also seek to serve. I respect that others have very different opinions and may credibly disagree with the above characterizations. I have erred on the side of extreme transparency and an honest disclosure of sincerely held views to demonstrate the seriousness with which the proposal was put forward and ultimately withdrawn. Sincerely, Kianga Daverington Founder, ACREinvest Founder & Managing Partner, Daverington PLLC

content.content: Summary of Executive & Polling Votes cast August 1, 2022 Community Greenlight Poll - bIBTA (Backed Finance Short-Term Bond ETF) - July 18, 2022 (thread) Voted: No (Defer) Reasoning: Voting against this Greenlight for two key reasons: (1) MakerDAO does not have the internal expertise or capacity to adequately evaluate this MIP from a legal and regulatory perspective prior to this vote as evident by the questions posed and information provided in the proposal. These items should be vetted BEFORE a vote to Greenlight. We’d like to see some traction on this discussion Embedding legal analysis on new governance proposals (2) We would wait for a liquid secondary market to develop and observe how it functions before Greenlighting. While at a high-level ACREinvest supports crypto-native collateral, onboarding a digital security of U.S. Government debt under any jurisdiction and governing law represents such complex issues of legal and regulatory risk that it should not be placed on the roster for further investigation at this time of apparent resource and budget reduction, and the community’s rejection/push back on recent proposals to strengthen and provision for oversight and legal resources.  Executive Proposals  POSTED JUL 28 2022  Onboarding Real World Asset Vaults - July 29, 2022 Onboards Real World Asset Vaults for Huntingdon Valley Bank (HVBank) and Societe Generale – Forge (OFH). There is no comparable work being done in DeFi and TradFi today as is reflected in the legal structures here, code implementation and post-execution integration of worlds. Congrats to all!

Summary of Executive & Polling Votes cast August 4, 2022 PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - August 1, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Opposed. Has anyone considered whether now might be an opportunity to leverage the MakerDAO brand and reputation for reliability, trust, security… etc., recent favorable publicity during a painful season of defaults, losses, fraud, failure to perform, collapse, bankruptcy, etc. to in fact RAISE prices or at least hold the status quo? The problem with vault demand is not going to be fixed by lowering fees. The revenue is sorely needed. This organization needs to take a more long-term, strategic and coordinated approach to proposing system changes rather than operating in narrow reactive silos with fixed, untested assumptions. Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters - August 1, 2022 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: Cannot support this proposal given poor attention to risk management issues that cannot be solved by merely sizing the value at risk below a certain threshold and relying on the reputation of others to protect MakerDAO’s interests. Tactical Re-allocation Process for Budget Adjustments - August 1, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: This proposal should have been withdrawn due to disagreement and confusion within the community and among the proposers and GovAlpha as to its contents, intentions and implementation. A proposal should not be put forth that contains a declaration of how the proposers would like the world to be, but not in fact how the world is. It is not the role of Recognized Delegates to be in the workforce or responsible for management of day-to-day activities. The following outcome “coordination” requirement with respect to MKR holders and Delegates is improper: “co-ordinate the budget re-allocation process with Core Unit, MKR holders and Recognized Delegates.” Carts are being put before the horses here, and community members seem to be taking cues directly from Rune and End Game meetings as to what the state of MakerDAO is. I believe any change in the responsibilities of Delegates with respect to a process such as this needs to be incorporated in its own on-chain vote with specificity and RFC- the whole nine yards. (https://vote.makerdao.com/executive/template-executive-vote-hvbank-drawdown-keeper-network-stream-re-deployment-august-03-2022) Supported Reasoning: Composed of validly approved determinations through our established governance process. content.content: Could you elaborate on your concerns with a tactical reallocation? There has been a tremendous amount of consternation in the community around budgets, expenses, and ensuring the protocol has sufficient runway to remain a going concern. SF took the initiative to ask the community how the protocol should be run (profitable, breakeven, at a loss but with sufficient runway) and MKR holders overwhelmingly supported operating at breakeven. SF then presented a couple paths forward, a broad cut or tactical reallocation. The community voted overwhelmingly both on the forums and on-chain to support the latter. I agree the wording of the poll was not ideal and not how we would’ve written it. MKR holders and delegates have the power to allocate capital, which no other actor in Governance has. The goal for the tactical reallocation is to have fully open and transparent meetings to align on the DAO’s budgeting priorities, KPIs for the Core Unit teams and therefore accountability to MKR holders, and visibility into Core Unit operations and performance.

content.content: Summary of Polling Votes cast August 17, 2022 Ratification Poll for Makershire Redux (MIP76) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Very pleased to see the persistence, dedication and care taken by the team to refine and resubmit a proposal we supported the first time. Excited to do so again, and quote a comment we shared on the forum:  "…voting yes for “Stable & Volatile”. An unacceptable risk of overall failure I see for MakerDAO is under utilizing its talented people!! We have the best in the business. I hate to see all the risk the community seems happy to absorb adding third parties to manage RWA on our behalf, but want to stifle so much we could be doing with our own teams and that’s crypto-native. Vamos!!"  MIP76: Makershire Redux - #45 by ACREinvest Community Greenlight Poll - RWA Arranger (BlockTower Credit) - August 15, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes (Greenlight) Reasoning: These are difficult times in different ways. The reasons each of us have for being in this community at this moment in history are vastly diverse. One thing applies to all equally, as has been made clear in recent days: we must decide on exactly which road to travel from here. Make no mistake. The road has forked. If you don’t choose a path, one will be chosen for you. I choose to accept that at the end of the day TRUST in people is all we have and the only foundation on which to build a new future. Code is written by humans after all. AI can’t save us (haven’t you been watching Westworld?). It is certain death for those we most want to help if individually we hide from the world, believing blindly in crypto or DeFi salvation. I see my role at MakerDAO as one for tackling the BIG systemic legacy problems. For that we need people who understand those problems and have a vision for realistic solutions. The BT presentation today Collateral Onboarding Call #47 | BlockTower Credit (Arranger) AMA combined with his wonderful essay Everything is Broken - by Daniel McCormick gave me the confidence in @humancapitol - specifically - to overcome my initial pessimism that now isn’t the right time to proceed further down the RWA road without necessary governance fixes in place. A YES vote here is going to help us along the right path to what MakerDAO is uniquely positioned to do at a crucial time. ~ Kianga Daverington on behalf of ACREinvest Maker Teleport Deployment on Starknet and Associated Risk Parameters - August 15, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: And the band played on! Congrats team. Thanks for your focus in moving forward along a key strategic path for our future.

Summary of Executive & Polling Votes cast August 22 - 25, 2022 Ratification Poll for Modify Dai Foundation Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP74) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Super Bear Scenario Reasoning: We are not convinced the budget and proposed scale of human resources is right-sized for the mandate. Seems too high, so we selected the lowest budget option. Ratification Poll for Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments (MIP4c2-SP15) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Seems to be a thoughtful and well-composed improvement by people who have been working hard for a while on the nitty gritty. Ratification Poll for Modify Oracle Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP75) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve existing budget (Business as usual) 2nd choice: Approve proposed budget (Reduced budget exempt from further cuts for 12 months) Reasoning: The Maker custom built oracle function is so important and so valuable to the protocol and is a key trust element for the user base. Productizing the oracle services as a business-line to bring in revenue should be pursued with gusto and expedition. Ratification Poll for MIP50 Direct Deposit Module Amendment (MIP4c2-SP23) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Thrilled to see a poll that tangibly advances the ambition of improving organic DAI growth via liquidity on other platforms. The flexibility provided by this change is necessary. Ratification Poll for Offboarding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) - August 8, 2022 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: The specter of RuneDAO was just too strong on this one for us to participate. If one reviews the flow of comments and how sentiment is influenced by a “certain large token holder” (a euphemism I keep hearing lately when it seems everyone ELSE knows Rune is being referred to…because such is said by people in chat on a zoom call (for example) whilst the speak professes concerns about the token holder’s privacy (???) - we have no ACTUAL idea), it paints a sad picture of governance-as-theater at MakerDAO.    MIP40c3-SP73: Modify Core Unit Budget (EVENTS-001)   Your options if opposed to this proposal are either lobby enough MKR to defeat the proposal (which seems difficult given Rune’s support for it, but there’s a lot of delegates with his MKR and some may be willing to oppose this proposal), or find a way to get the author to withdraw the proposal.   The comment above was stated after Rune came out in favor of the offboarding. He subsequently changed in mind and informed the community of his support and voila! the offboarding is defeated.     MIP40c3-SP73: Modify Core Unit Budget (EVENTS-001) Archive       Don’t have time to read all the details, but I think that we are seeing decent progress on a broad and unified budget reduction strategy and so I am no longer in favor of abruptly offboarding this core unit.  As others are suggesting, we should wait with retiring the core unit until a proper attempt has been made to consolidate events under growth and marketing, and I think it should be considered to have a corresponding modest budget increase, if necessary and with clear KPIs and results expect…     Our sentiment on this vote was expressed here in context of a discussion about the lack of human capital management function at the DAO, which is extremely problematic under the current actual state of centralized power.    Signal Request: MKR Pro-Rata Vesting Community Sentiment Poll   I am also troubled that Delegates are looked to as the HR department as well which in practice for some seems to be doing what a “certain large token holder” is saying either privately or publicly on the Forum (as was the case with how the DAO should handle the Events CU offboarding - leading ACREinvest to abstain on that vote and otherwise distance our platform from engaging in what we view as management activities, HR and workforce administration). Very pleased to see compliance concerns have been resolved and everything is back on track.

content.content: Summary of Executive & Polling Votes cast August 29 -31, 2022 Community Greenlight Poll - Cabot (Cabot Renewable Energy Crypto Mining LLC) - August 15, 2022 (thread) Voted: No (Defer) Reasoning: No new business can be responsibly greenlit in this environment of uncertainty - even chaos - and live efforts to massively cut resources, offboard crucial CUs (such as Strategic Finance) and change the entire governance and operating structure of the DAO. Community Greenlight Poll - DDC (Detox Digital Coin) - August 15, 2022 (thread) Voted: No (Defer) Reasoning: No new business can be responsibly greenlit in this environment of uncertainty - even chaos - and live efforts to massively cut resources, offboard crucial CUs (such as Strategic Finance) and change the entire governance and operating structure of the DAO. We missed the vote for two polls ending August 25, 2022 due to user error (ID 854 and 855). Somehow they escaped our review of what needed to be voted on and when. The decision probably would have been to abstain on both. Organizational disfunction is forcing teams to improvise in order to continue executing their mandates as well as advance action in the overall best interest of the DAO and MKR holders. We recognize that and commend the effort. However, deciding on a target spend level in the absence of progress as to DAO restructuring (if that’s what happening) and/or strategic alignment doesn’t make sense. It could be that those with enough voting power to decide the big issues are happy to make a call on this downstream item, in which case we defer to the winning vote as to what the spend level should be. As for the Collateral Onboarding request, the evolution of this request was just plain confusing and there hasn’t been enough time to research all the tangents, consider all the angles and then truly this level of management decision is not the proper tasking for Delegates in the current governance model. Accordingly, abstain would have been the best vote for us as we will do going forward when decision are put forward to a vote that we think reflect or react in unhealthy ways to the sub-optimal operating situation for the whole organization. We have come to think of Abstaining as a kind of quiet protest that is mostly symbolic, but perhaps (hopefully) may put some other kind of social pressure to raise the bar on what the community collectively will consider acceptable as the status quo. content.content: DELEGATE PLATFORM UPDATE - September 27, 2022 Following last week’s announcement by the United States Commodity Futures Trading Commission and federal civil enforcement actions against a decentralized autonomous organization, ACREinvest has performed an internal review of its role as a Recognized Delegate for MakerDAO, including when attributed to Kianga Daverington as either a representative of the firm or in her individual capacity. We have determined that we are comfortable continuing our work on behalf of MKR token holders delegating to our contract, and on behalf of the entire MakerDAO community who we also represent and consider stakeholders on our decisions. Following this Tweet and upon consultation with counsel, we determined that voting “Abstain” would not in any meaningful way clarify, reduce or remove regulatory compliance risk for our involvement in the community.   twitter.com    kianga.eth 🌍 1000 ACRE DAOs in 1000 Days @fhomoney  We may need to Abstain on votes going forward if compliance questions are not immediately made top priority. I've been a commodities/derivatives lawyer for a bit. Unclear what special ethical obligations could be imputed to @ACREinvest regardless of NOT providing legal services. twitter.com/ACREinvest/sta…   ACREinvest Web3 Governance & Social Incentives @ACREinvest  We just voted on 6 @MakerDAO governance polls! We accordingly explicitly reserve rights with respect to the performance, promises of performance or assents to performance of/by ACREinvest, its partners, affiliates and managers (including Kianga Daverington) and any individual contributor or advisor to our work here through the decentralized community ACRE DAOs or other means, in each instance without prejudice.

ACREinvest regretfully determined to take this course of action going forward due to what we interpret as confirmation in the last 24 hours that controlling MKR leadership of the organization does not and will not commit to legal and regulatory compliance per Discord conversation today between Kianga and Rune, and this Endgame MIP thread discussion: MIP84: Activate Protocol-Owned Vault Emulation - #62 by ACREinvest Compliance has been specified as one of our core values since we published our Delegate Platform in December 2021. ACREinvest is coming up to that line and once it is crossed, all the trolls here will be better able to enjoy the lovely harmony that Dear Leader obedience brings even if in MY OPINION it destroys something that could have been truly remarkable for the world. I’ll keep standing for a different ideal and continue speaking out to protect the interests of those who are silenced here or not at liberty for various reasons to speak truth to power, and for as long as this Delegate Contract is active and MKR holders continue their delegation. ~ Kianga

content.content: Not that Kianga needs me to Stan for her, but particular in light of regulatory action in the US, it’s completely reasonable for anyone based there (especially an attorney) to reevaluate their voting practices. Anyone can undelegate in response. And the DAO can even change it’s delegate compensation rules if it views this practice as abusive. But telling a delegate who continues to have community support from delegation, who continues to comply with the delegate rules, and who meaningfully explains their position to “go away” strikes me as much more contrary to the spirit of an open DAO than protesting a policy direction by abstaining. @ACREinvest , I do wish that instead of just waiting for divine intervention to bring regulatory consciousness to the DAO, you would propose a MIP. There are a lot of tricky issues to consider, and you’re probably in the top 1% of dedicated participants here with skills to effectively issue spot and manage counsel to bring about an actionable roadmap to protect DAO members and create a community everyone can feel safe participating in.

You can find the whole article here or a short version on twitter.  The overall idea is that MakerDAO is a bank just like any other. Not regulated just like eurodollar banking. Banks are businesses that try to maximize profit by having the biggest spread between funding rate (DSR) and lending rate (SF). We should have the higher SF (i.e. more risk) and the lowest DSR (i.e. low perceived risk for DAI holders). The…

content.content: smartcontracts:  Most of us continue to believe that the community’s is too clever, too nimble, and too smartly organised to face any meaningful legal risks. All risks get trapped in the ToS anyway, and I think the “Howey Test” concerns wouldn’t apply in practice   At the risk of being the bearer of bad news, I’m not sure a single element of the above is true. Maker does not exist on an island exempt from the broader legal and regulatory paradigm and that’s a crucial fact at the heart of the back-and-forth about the protocol’s direction. Certainly, it is stretching the bounds of optimism past the point of plausibility to argue that Maker is too ‘nimble’ or ‘smartly organised’ to face meaningful legal risks. This is not a nimble or particularly cohesive organization, and as a decentralized protocol Maker can’t rely on contractual terms either as some kind of shield (and nor should it).

content.content: Summary of Executives & Polling Votes cast October 13 - 22, 2022 In line with our communications over the past few weeks, we cannot express an opinion on business-as-usual signals and polls, and will not support new Executives unless and until there is a clearly expressed commitment via on-chain vote to prioritize a new status quo where MakerDAO’s operating structure has a researched and informed basis on which to conclude it is in compliance with any laws in any jurisdiction to which it may be subject, if any. With respect to what taking regulatory risk seriously for the whole of the organization looks like and coming up with an informed consensus on what may be required to operate lawfully in all jurisdictions, we acknowledge that our purist view seems to be out-of-step with the controlling views of the community. We also acknowledge that a minority are communicating quite articulately and well on the need to change the messaging with respect to compliance with laws while also devoting resources to tackle the challenge head-on. Notwithstanding, given the current state of the Endgame MIP set vote at the time of posting this Delegate Platform Update we remain of the view that it would be appropriate to conclude our participation in the community as a Delegate at the expiration of our contract next month. Please refer to our recent Delegate Platform update for important clarifications regarding our Terms of Delegate Service ACREinvest Delegate Platform - #47 by ACREinvest Ratification Poll for Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set - October 10, 2022 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We are first and foremost opposed to the manner, methods and lengths Rune has used and reached to attempt total personal control of the outcome of this vote and MakerDAO as a whole into the future. For that reason alone, we vote no. If there are any merits within this take-it-or-leave-it massive bundle of fundamental organization changes, even these are irreparably tainted when implemented in this manner. Organizational capture is an apt phrase to describe the outcome of the past several months where diverse perspectives and support for un-conflicted multi-polar leadership to emerge have not been allowed much oxygen or political cover to develop. content.content: Summary of Executives & Polling Votes cast October 23 - November 3, 2022 Since casting our vote against the Endgame MIP set, we have not voted in or supported subsequent Polls and Executives, respectively. Our reason is that we’ve taken time to evaluate our views about MakerDAO, and our role, responsibilities and potential liability as a Recognized Delegate in light of this new regime. Our opposition to the Endgame plan remains steadfast. Both the manner in which it was forced onto the community and flagrant disregard for its many fatal flaws render the result a complete and total tragedy. We are in agreement with the critiques very well detailed in a number of posts by other Recognized Delegates and prominent members of the community including:     LFWs Endgame Commentary Governance       Feels like this should go without saying with that title. But to be explicit: these thoughts and comments represent my personal position, rather than GovAlpha’s.    LFWs Endgame Commentary  Aims  Highlight perceived risks with the Endgame plan that may have gone under-examined. Encourage changes in how the Endgame plan is realised to avoid the situation where Maker is locked into doing or continuing to do something that is not working. Suggest simplifications to the proposed Endgame structure.  …         A16z Endgame Thoughts Governance       Overview  In the spirit of @LongForWisdom’s thorough Endgame Commentary, we wanted to publicly clarify our thinking surrounding the overall strategic direction for MakerDAO, and the Endgame Plan’s role in it going forward.  As many others have pointed out, the Endgame Plan contains a number of innovative ideas, but the proposals are complex and involve interlocking concepts that will dramatically change MakerDAO moving forward. We deeply appreciate all of @Rune’s efforts to this point, and in re…         London Business School Delegate Platform Delegates       We are voting NO to the Endgame Plan Prelaunch MIP Set and set out our rationale below. Our response focuses on a critique of the Endgame Plan rather than its implementation details as set out in the sub-proposals to this MIP set.  Summary and context  We understand that the Endgame Plan proposed by Rune is a roadmap for Maker to achieve maximal growth and decentralisation over the next 10+ years of its operation and bundles together a number of interrelated components, some of which we consider…     Essay by @luca_pro # 47 | Tribes & Endgames: DAOs Stretching Themselves Tweet thread by @Hasu https://twitter.com/hasufl/status/1584879485748678656?s=20&t=HJa_c-ERXHx0fuqASQrjkQ Despite its success in the Governance polling vote, the evidence that the Endgame plan does NOT have consensus approval or buy-in from the MakerDAO community-at-large is overwhelming. Exhibit A Informal poll on support for Rune's Endgame proposal We also cannot know from the on-chain vote what the views are of a huge portion of MKR holders who for various reasons do not or cannot participate in on-chain voting. Exhibit B Tweet Thread by @SebVentures https://twitter.com/SebVentures/status/1584875892555268096?s=20&t=HJa_c-ERXHx0fuqASQrjkQ Accordingly, we have determined that the outcome of the Endgame vote DOES NOT reflect the decision of the actual community and therefore we do not attribute the views and approach taken by the Endgame MIP set to be dispositive for the whole of MakerDAO, the decentralized autonomous organization. We commend and applaud and tip all the hats to the full-time contributors, Core Unit members and Facilitators in particular who continue to execute their mandates during trying times in accordance with the outcome of Governance decisions, as well they should.  “Neither snow nor rain nor heat nor gloom of night stays these couriers from the swift completion of their appointed rounds”  Since we have some skin in the game at this point, and believe it might still be possible that MakerDAO is in FACT beyond the reach of powers that want to centralize control for their own ends, we are taking liberties to continue our unique mode of “protest participation.” This will necessarily mean our active visible engagement will be significantly reduced, but we will be watching closely. In order to continue our support for the community members and MKR holders who would like to see MakerDAO lead in: (1) truly decentralizing power, (2) implementing conflicts of interest standards and other compliance measures that protect the core protocol value and its sustainability, and (3) encouraging participatory leadership and inclusion of all ecosystem stakeholders (including DAI holders) we have decided to HOLD SPACE in honor of those who journeyed before us and for the future many would like to see by renewing our Recognized Delegate contract. Our stance regarding governance votes remains unchanged. Accordingly, as previously stated we:     ACREinvest:  will not support new Executives unless and until there is a clearly expressed commitment via on-chain vote to prioritize a new status quo where MakerDAO’s operating structure has a researched and informed basis on which to conclude it is in compliance with any laws in any jurisdiction to which it may be subject, if any.   Any polls that may be offered in the future will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, but we will refrain from casting a vote for as long as we believe the overall direction of MakerDAO to be unfocused and unresourced with respect to the totality of its legal and compliance responsibilities, including conflicts of interest standards and other checks and balances necessary for the protection of individual community members and all stakeholders in this important DeFi infrastructure.

content.content: Thank you, I had not noticed. I withdraw my previous message. I’m just confused now I guess.

The rules for Recognized Delegates are very clear, so the appropriate pay of compensation has been decided by MKR holders and is not a subject open for debate as to what is appropriate. You will find some details set forth here: https://mips.makerdao.com/mips/details/MIP4c2SP24#changes That said, we may have been the inspiration for an amendment to these rules now in RFC MIP4c2-SP29: Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics The above reflects the proper way for altering the behavior of participants through a governance designed and approved process that can implement incentive changes. There should be a healthy amount of respect by all community members regarding the rules all agree to participate under. When it comes to disagreeing with the manner in which someone chooses to engage, this is absolutely fine and encouraged, but your disapproval should not be conflated with that someone having taken improper or inappropriate action. Any compensation paid to ACREinvest is compensation earned no matter how anyone feels about it. You will note that compensation requires participation in voting and communicating reasons for voting, and is tied to the amount of MKR delegated. Our decisions regarding voting are understood to have an impact on compensation, whereas participation in the community and governance can still occur whilst NOT voting. Our Delegate Contract from the past year of service expired at the end of November. No MKR has migrated to the new contract which does not signal an active removal of delegation, and is often a process that can take some time for MKR holders to notice and move delegation to the new contract. We do not know if our current delegators under the expired contract will find it interesting to re-delegate to a Recognized Delegate who is not currently voting. There are a number of Recognized Delegates who do not vote often or communicate and therefore do not receive compensation, but have MKR delegated to them and are still Recognized Delegates per the rules of MakerDAO. Hope that provides some clarity on the subject. Thanks for your interest and taking the time to share your thoughts.
