content.content: New for 2023: ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGE As of January 10, 2023, our Founder Kianga Daverington will be posting on the Forum as @DaveringtonPLLC while we transition the firm to a purely administrative service on behalf of a decentralized group of contributors who are members of the ACRE DAOs network (Autonomous Communities for Regenerative Economies). Across the DeFi ecosystem governance is mostly an unpaid privilege expected to be performed by the owners of governance crypto assets. MakerDAO is among a handful of large projects that do provide compensation for governance services through the Recognized Delegate program we’ve had the pleasure to participate in since December 2021. Internal and external events of the past year have exposed shortcomings in the current state of decentralized protocol governance and the urgent need to try new things. WE CAN HAVE NICE THINGS ACREinvest is doing our part with today’s announcement and accelerating long-held plans to provide services through decentralized groups of contributors. An “Origin Story” page has been added to our website for those who want the full back-story. We are sharing here this concept drawing from July 2021 to hopefully illustrate the alignment we perceive has occurred between this platform and the MakerDAO community with last week’s announcements about changes in the Endgame plan and implementation.  ACRE DAO_Acre VNS_Acre of America_RHOZ1920×1440 257 KB  In particular, we are pleased to see a prominent emphasis on legal and compliance issues.    Endgame updates & link for Endgame call tonight at 2pm ET/8pm CET   Compliance and short term products Another set of useful improvements is compliance and legal resilience from leveraging the increased knowledge we have as it relates to various legal and regulatory risks and opportunities. This additional risk reduction allows to move faster with certain products and launches with the safety of following best practice on defi frontend compliance. This in turn puts us in a better position to develop strong long term solutions for unbreakable decentralization.   We are also very supportive of postponing tokenomics changes and suspending the POVE implementation. Accordingly, ACREinvest is preparing to RESUME VOTING on behalf of our delegated MKR holders with decisions powered by an anon decentralized collective of NFT holders (the ACREinvest ReFi Collective) who are passionate about the power of DeFi to regenerate finance for the benefit of the “real” world and all of her people. Further information about participation in this group may be obtained by sending us a message on Blockscan Chat to acreinvest.eth. Communications should be from NON-doxxed ethereum addresses and you should not include any personally identifiable information in your message. The Collective through ACREinvest has retained @DaveringtonPLLC for advice on how to operate in this unconventional manner. Kianga Daverington as Principal Attorney @DaveringtonPLLC is empowered to oversee, veto or override decisions of the Collective with respect to ACREinvest’s voting and communications for reasons of illegality or reputational risk in her sole discretion. OUR NEW DELEGATE CONTRACT IS OPEN FOR BUSINESS Our Delegate Contract was renewed in November 2022. If you previously delegated MKR to us, we would welcome your re-delegation to the new contract and if are a MKR holder that was not with us in 2022, we invite you to join us now! What do we hope to accomplish with these organizational changes? ACREinvest is pioneering a new concept for professional governance delegation that is rapidly scalable organically through the same network effects and social incentives that DeFi protocols themselves enjoy. You can see in our concept drawing above that we’ve been thinking in terms of subDAOs and internal community tokens for quite some time. We believe the changes we are implementing in 2023 greatly complement the pre-game scoping work and Constitution development needs of MakerDAO. By anchoring toward completely anon attribution for our decisions, we hope to filter out distracting and divisive political dynamics while creating a safe space for all to engage without insecurity or fear of backlash. Until now, Recognized Delegates and their decisions have been attributable to individuals and firms whose identities you know. This is a strong basis for trust and credibility. However, we think it will be interesting to flip this model on its head. Let’s fool around and find out if a decentralized anon group can gain your trust purely on the basis of track record and official communications. In our instance, of course, the reputation and particular experience set on which this Delegate Platform began continues on in some form with the new structure. We will update our initial profile information above and appearing on the Voting Portal in due course. From our new Origin Story page:  ACRE DAOs - A GLOBAL NETWORK In 2023, we are activating a new model for DeFi protocol layer operations where the workforce needed to execute governance functions are compensated permissionlessly based upon the collective success of its network members’ contributions across the DeFi ecosystem. This approach reduces ACREinvest (the firm) to a purely administrative agent optimized to pass-through payments as trustee for the benefit of individual contributors doing open finance work. Our solution includes a spoke-hub global distribution of communities (subDAOs) connected by (1) their shared adoption of a single social currency - the $ACRE ERC-20 token, (2) multi-stakeholder governance of a permissionless income protocol (DOER Money DAO) for the benefit of $ACRE earners, and (3) a Charitable Remainder Trust legal entity structure.  Please note communications to ACREinvest as Recognized Delegate should be done by public mention on the Forum or Discord. Contacting Kianga Daverington directly should be done via @DaveringtonPLLC on the Forum or Discord kianga#9300.

content.content: PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We support the increase in fees and expect that RWA generated income will more than offset any income lost by discouraged users. Confirm Trial Deployment of DssKiln - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Burn 0.5 million DAI worth of MKR 2nd choice: Do not burn any MKR Reasoning: This is an important technical solution with many use cases expected for future implementation. We would like to see it tested live and in the wild now. We are not otherwise supportive of burning MKR in line with the historical norm. Approve One-time MKR Distribution to Correct CES-001 Incentive Program Shortfall - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: We are abstaining on all polls that deal with Core Unit budgets and off-boardings directly tied to the fallout from the initial Endgame plan approval and resulting workforce turmoil. We defer to the decisions of others closer to the discussion and planning on how the current Endgame vision will chart a positive and successful course for the future. Ratification Poll for Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP29) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Reject both changes Reasoning: We oppose this proposal which was launched as a political attack against ACREinvest to intimidate and penalize us financially for lawful conduct that the proposing Recognized Delegate found personally objectionable. As many know, we were in the minority with respect to our views on the proposed Endgame MIP set and related matters. Our objections were sincerely held. We believed a full consideration of our points was mission critical for this community and those with the power to implement changes. Initially abstaining and, later, ceasing entirely from all voting and Executive support were permissible ways we could draw attention to our concerns. We are pleased to resume voting today because after several months we have been heard: ACREinvest Delegate Platform - #85 by ACREinvest Anyone supporting this proposal will be encouraging behaviour that allows a powerful and influential FEW to target those who disagree with measures disguised as for the common good, but in fact are narrowly politically motivated to suppress dissent. MIP4c2-SP29: Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics - #5 by ACREinvest We agree with sentiments Rune shared on yesterday’s DVC call*: Delegates should not have the power to control the terms of their compensation, especially when that power can be abused in ways that threaten the integrity of the system by petty actions from its most trusted community stewards. *Anyone can view yesterday’s (January 11, 2023), previous and future meetings once uploaded to the Open Decentralized Voter Committee YouTube Playlist Ratification Poll for Defense Fund (MIP55c3-SP14) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: Unintended consequences for implementing this the wrong way could be significant in a very sensitive area touching DAO contributor potential legal liabilities. Without the full picture being understood and subject to a much more transparent and accountable diligence process and legal review we do not support implementation in pieces.

Polls: Ratification Poll for Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) (MIP4c2-SP28) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: This collectively observed break is very important for the resilience and health of the human-members of the community. The core workforce works extremely hard all year. The opportunity to downshift and have a different set of expectations apply should continue when the rest of humanity is also slowing down and retreating from work. Teams are well able to manage emergencies or any surprises under the status quo. Ratification Poll for MIP14 Repeal (MIP4c4-SP2) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: In this time of transition and processes going away with uncertainty about what, when and how new Endgame frameworks will replace them, we are persuaded by Patrick_J’s comments that MIP14 is an available process that may prove more useful in the future than it has thus far. Ratification Poll for Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster (MIP55c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: All new business and proposals that seek to implement new workforce structures should be put on hold pending guidance that will be forthcoming in Q2 following community discussion on a set of pre-Endgame proposals coming soon. We understand short-term operating rules and priorities to guide the community over the next 2 years will be submitted for ratification by MKR vote at the end of Q1. Today we saw a number of exciting MIPs introduced, including this one on Work Proposal Frameworks MIP98 - The Work Proposal Framework, that we should focus on developing for the fair use and equal access by all who would like to provide services to or fulfill needs of the DAO. Ratification Poll for Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation (MIP63c4-SP5) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: We are generally in favor of this onboard, but lack the internal expertise at this time to directly evaluate the technical aspects. Ratification Poll for Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults (MIP13c3-SP13) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We very much support the spirit and intention of this proposal. However, it is more likely to clutter the landscape and potentially conflict with or distract from efforts already underway by persons deeply engaged day-to-day on the problems identified. We understand short-term operating rules and priorities to guide the community over the next 2 years will be submitted for ratification by MKR vote at the end of Q1. Today we saw a number of exciting MIPs introduced, including this one on Work Proposal Frameworks MIP98 - The Work Proposal Framework. RWA presents a host of issues best treated comprehensively and with the right composition of dedicated Core resources (Facilitator DAOs) and Ecosystem Actors and/or subDAOs. In any case, the work and approach should be highly and expertly coordinated to follow the DAO-wide Endgame Framework and Scopes development processes. Ratification Poll for Onboard PSM USDC to Yearn to earn Yield (MIP92) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We are very excited about this proposal and potential to work with Yearn on strengthening crypto-native strategies. However, our across-the-board view is that no new business should be approved until we understand short-term operating rules and priorities that will guide the community over the next 2 years. New pre-Endgame stance MIPs are being introduced this month for community discussion and ratification by MKR vote at the end of Q1 2023. Ratification Poll for MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment (MIP4c2-SP31) - January 9, 2023 (thread) Voted: Abstain Reasoning: We lack the internal expertise at this time to understand and directly evaluate the technical aspects of this proposal. Accordingly, we defer to the judgement of others among Delegates and Core Units who have expressed support and whom we trust on these matters.

content.content: Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling - January 16, 2023 (thread) Voted: Decrease to 100m DAI 1st choice only We support maintaining the Gemini relationship, but reducing exposure meaningfully. The most important risk to manage urgently is MakerDAO’s own capacity to engage expertly with “Real World” counterparties and manage those relationships and their risks extremely well. If from a human resources perspective this can’t be done in a timely fashion, there is too much risk on the table to continue. We consider that market confidence and reputation/trust deterioration in Gemini are as important as triggers for the worst case scenario as are poor legal structures, potential regulatory violations (SEC allegations and penalties sought are VERY serious) and what collateral is where backing GUSD. Speaking of reputation, we think maintaining the PSM at this difficult time may provide some relief to those who are victims of the contagion and this is a role MakerDAO should be proud to serve. Accordingly, we should go to some lengths to preserve what could still be a positive outcome for MakerDAO and ALL as originally hoped IF we can manage the situation well. Continuing with good outcomes, however, requires resources engaged to do the difficult substantive work. We have this invitation from Tyler today:    GUSD & MakerDAO Partnership Update   We are also happy to consider implementing additional processes for increased transparency (e.g., regular meetings with core teams, joining community calls, and other mechanisms to promote transparency and provide needed information) if the community would find it valuable.   Let’s do it. Decrease GUSD PSM Fee Out (tout) - January 16, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We vote YES on reducing the tout to 0, making the PSM attractive for arbitrageurs to reduce MakerDAO exposure if market conditions support such trade. We understand from community discussion that relatively little is likely to exit organically. If reducing the position significantly and quickly is desired, Maker would most likely need to appoint a real-world legal entity to act as a counterparty to Gemini who could redeem directly for USD. This presents a HOST of “real world” issues. The bankruptcy of Gemini is only but ONE of many practical problems for MakerDAO in managing the situation. As a non-legal person, MakerDAO cannot directly handle fiat and has unknown & unknowable standing should any legal process be required to access or enforce remedies against any of (1) Gemini or (2) a 3rd party permitted to hold title to any Maker assets (such as USD redeemed for GUSD) or (3) any bank or custodian that would have actual possession of Maker assets (on behalf of Gemini or a 3rd party engaged by Maker). We note that $MKR holders have neither approved a 3rd party nor has an agreement with any 3rd party to act on MakerDAO’s behalf with respect to holding title to protocol assets in this case, maintaining custody or use or transfer of those assets, or converting $GUSD via Gemini to USD, or otherwise. Per discussion with GovAlpha in Office Hours yesterday, we understand another poll would be needed for further MakerDAO-directed action to actively reduce exposure.

touché! We love the game. But we would be remiss if we didn’t point out some evidence that ACREinvest was in fact the “inspiration” for the proposal:    MIP4c2-SP29: Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics   This list lacks the delegate that has made a specific point about abstaining every vote and thus the corner case this amendment is particularly relevant for.

Adjust the Debt Floor (dust) - January 23, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: No Change Reasoning: We vote for no change. MakerDAO should reinforce the message and act consistently with the intention that it is a protocol operating for use by institutions and professional ecosystem participants. For access by retail and others operating at small scale, focus should be to support L2 and third-party app integrations that serve downstream/upstream/cross-stream(?) users. Income projections, strategy for expense management, marketing and partnership development should have this focus on professional actors as a central guiding theme. We are also thinking about “real world” compliance frames that would be most appropriate IF MakerDAO was a CeFi firm, which of course it is NOT. Nevertheless, we can still be aware and distinguish between responsibilities and features that may be appropriate for serving retail end users vs sophisticated parties or other protocols whether or not externally enforced rules can or should apply. Offboarding Parameters for USDC-A, USDP-A, and GUSD-A - January 23, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Good clean up to improve focus on and function of other stablecoins in the MakerDAO system via the PSM mechanisms.

content.content: Executive Proposals  POSTED JAN 26 2023  MOMC Parameter Changes, GUSD PSM tout Decrease, CES MKR Transfer, Flash Mint Module Upgrade, Cage Aave D3M - January 27, 2023 (Maker Governance - Proposal MOMC Parameter Changes, GUSD PSM tout Decrease, CES MKR Transfer, Flash Mint Module Upgrade, Cage Aave D3M - January 27, 2023) Supported We were the first to sign for this Executive last Friday because we have been eager for the GUSD PSM Tout Decrease to go into effect. The latest news this morning of troubles at Gemini shared here “GUSD & MakerDAO Partnership Update - #12 by DaveringtonPLLC” further underscores the importance of implementing some kind of risk management action. However, it is noted and should be understood by all that this change alone is only one action among many that may be appropriate to take at this time. As we communicated at the time of the relevant Poll:     ACREinvest:  Reasoning: We vote YES on reducing the tout to 0, making the PSM attractive for arbitrageurs to reduce MakerDAO exposure if market conditions support such trade. We understand from community discussion that relatively little is likely to exit organically. If reducing the position significantly and quickly is desired, Maker would most likely need to appoint a real-world legal entity to act as a counterparty to Gemini who could redeem directly for USD. This presents a HOST of “real world” issues. The bankruptcy of Gemini is only but ONE of many practical problems for MakerDAO in managing the situation. As a non-legal person, MakerDAO cannot directly handle fiat and has unknown & unknowable standing should any legal process be required to access or enforce remedies against any of (1) Gemini or (2) a 3rd party permitted to hold title to any Maker assets (such as USD redeemed for GUSD) or (3) any bank or custodian that would have actual possession of Maker assets (on behalf of Gemini or a 3rd party engaged by Maker). We note that $MKR holders have neither approved a 3rd party nor has an agreement with any 3rd party to act on MakerDAO’s behalf with respect to holding title to protocol assets in this case, maintaining custody or use or transfer of those assets, or converting $GUSD via Gemini to USD, or otherwise. Per discussion with GovAlpha in Office Hours yesterday, we understand another poll would be needed for further MakerDAO-directed action to actively reduce exposure.   ACREinvest continues to support dialogue, engagement and strengthening the Gemini partnership in some form for as long as that remains sensible. That said, we do not have confidence MakerDAO is well positioned today to expertly negotiate the challenges and issues presented. This is a worry. Finally, we acknowledge a concern raised in the Governance Discord channel about the following language in the Executive Spell, and would like to address any questions folks might have as to how we were comfortable voting so quickly given this odd inclusion.  Executive spell text1284×1162 116 KB  Answer: We regularly attend Core Unit weekly public meetings for the express purpose of staying current and having a deeper context from which to evaluate and execute Delegate responsibilities. PECU members can attest that either members of ACRE DAOs and/or @DaveringtonPLLC joins them often on Tuesdays just to listen in and learn - including during the period when we were not engaged in active voting. @GFXlabs and @flipflopflapdelegate can also confirm since we regularly see them at CU meetings as well. @brianmcmichael shared an explanation about the Spell text in question to the group in Discord and posted a link to this detailed description.

content.content: Short Ratification Poll for Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund Endgame Information Portal (MIP14c2-SP3) - January 30, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: While we support the objective of increasing engagement with governance via experiments with JokeDAO and other methods that open up MakerDAO to more and various forms of participation, at this time and regarding Endgame communication specifically, we believe it is too early to provision for such a solution. Current work being doing by GovAlpha to organize information should be given space to proceed and reach a steady state before we clutter the scene with multiple disparate efforts. See, e.g., Endgame.makerdao.com Subdomain This MIP14 request is more likely to add confusion about what’s the best authoritative current source, waste efforts and require maintenance via attention, labor and additional funding to become a finished and useful project. Let’s consolidate focus where the work is already happening, and later in a more coordinated fashion consider how additional resources can be added.

content.content: Update the Multisig Managing the Velodrome NFT - January 6, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We have been a supporter of the Velodrome engagement since the beginning and very much support active engagement with the protocol-owned native tokens of other projects. It would be great to have a public meeting at MakerDAO with the Velodrome team to educate the community about the activities the Multisig is controlling, how the group operates and makes decisions, and how the process and broader strategy for this type of metaGovernance is being captured in the Endgame scoping. PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - February 6, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: We are happy to support this proposal that’s thinking smartly about how to grow and improve MakerDAO’s core and established product offerings. It’s time to hone in and leverage ROI from what’s already built, and be painfully conservative about new business initiatives - especially those that radically increase the attack threat surface with new products marketed directly by MakerDAO to retail and delivered through Maker-owned front ends. We are mindful that with any NEW ventures, governance is now on notice with respect to the changing worldwide regulatory and enforcement landscape. FWIW, we do not share market consensus on the forward U.S. interest rate picture, and caution against business strategy that assumes which way U.S. treasury yields will go from here. content.content: Thank you, great to know!. We probably don’t even know enough to have specific questions today. But the presentation to the community to explain the A, B, Cs of what it’s all about would be great at a convenient time.

Ratification Poll for Restart a daily $100 Micro-Burn of MKR in Show of Good Faith to MKR Holders (MIP74c1-SP1) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Ratification Poll - Declaration of Intent - Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address (MIP13c3-SP14) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: The same reasoning applies to both polls above. There should be no approvals at this stage of isolated Declarations of Intent, and non-critical ideas addressed to a future potential state of MakerDAO. Work of a prospective nature needs to be considered in context with the organizational restructuring and alignment attempt underway via the Endgame Plan. A decision on the substance proposed here naturally can only FOLLOW a determination on other key strategic choices regarding retail users and MakerDAO’s social orientation toward its stakeholders. If approved to go forward, the Endgame Constitution radically shifts how technical work can be initiated and who/which contributing entities have responsibility and accountability for deliverables and maintenance. We see a general lack of sensitivity in the community to the amplification of spiraling chaos being unleashed by the continuing approval of things without any concern or regard for the organizational ORDER MakerDAO must urgently put in place. Without raising the bar on upholding the integrity of process, we are lost on the road to the Endgame even before we start. As for the BURN, specifically, we remain unconvinced of its efficacy and appropriateness in 2023 with rather substantial other dynamics at work to support a value proposition for holding MKR. The community’s emotional attachment to the burn mechanism from days of yore needs to evolve with the times (as has everything else to do with MakerDAO). Ratification Poll for Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities (MIP4c2-SP33) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Approve and appreciate the diligence and attention to ORDER through these kinds of governance documentation updates. Ratification Poll for Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process (MIP4c2-SP30) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: These are thoughtful improvements based on experience, and very useful to ratify now nothwithstanding that processes may be overwritten, redefined or refined in the pregame Constitutional Scopes work. It’s critical we maintain the governance rules as they HAVE been ratified and not neglect order for the sake of what may be presumed to come online in the future. Ratification Poll for $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations (MIP95) - February 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We are consistent in voting no on all new business during this quarter when the future state of organizational priorities, resource allocation and workforce responsibilities is unknown/unconfirmed. The Endgame Constitution MIPs scheduled for a vote next month - if approved - will put a new steady state in place. It’s regretful this vote was rushed despite warnings from the community that the timing was bad and success more likely with additional time spent in RFC. If this poll fails, we hope Cogent will revisit opportunities with MakerDAO if there’s still a match as the Real World Asset Scope Framework comes online and evolves. Audit and Review Work for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Engineering Resource for Phoenix Labs - February 20, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: On both above polls we are voting no in an attempt to protect the integrity of the proposed Endgame Plan, which claims to solve for the corrosive culture of privately negotiated special treatment without appropriate safeguards and protections for conflicts of interest and self dealing. Decisions that happen without transparency and scrutiny and input via the processes, methods and expectations codified through onchain MKR votes lack legitimacy. A thread of our specific comments when this initiative was first recently announced can be found HERE and HERE. It would really be tragic if the new era of Endgame being sold to protect the organization and its stakeholders from such machinations, is actually launched with the very thing it claims to defeat being front and center thus contaminating the waters for what might otherwise be a good idea. We cannot tell. There has been little objective review, zero legal or regulatory risk analysis and the design contemplates an organizational structure that does not exist. Anything to do with Phoenix Labs and Spark should be paused full stop and proposed for approvals through an appropriate PUBLIC and ratified governance process. content.content: PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal - February 27, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Terrific report - we love to see this suite of growth oriented recommendations. While the cost of increased DSR usage in the short term might net-out a large portion of the revenue increases from the proposed higher stability fees, we see an important tail wind developing. The exciting takeaway is that the DSR story is driving demand for and adoption of DAI as a treasury diversification asset for large decentralized projects/communities. There are many levers to activate as this trend accelerates which could lead to success across multiple other priorities, such as the concept of a DeFi-wide “risk-free rate” anchored by the MakerDAO protocol. Powerful stuff.

Short Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs Initial Funding (MIP55c3-SP15) - March 6, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Reasoning: Since a recent onchain poll vote has confirmed Governance approval to continue resource support for Phoenix Labs, we are very much in favor of this allocation of funds for their legal spend, which we hope will include due diligence and input from U.S. counsel with appropriate financial markets experience so there can be a full risk assessment and advice to inform product development and communications that best protect MKR holders and the MakerDAO ecosystem from additional and new adverse risks. The budget is insufficient and certainly there is not time to procure and implement any such advice for an April launch of anything. No one acting for Phoenix Labs can obtain legal advice for the benefit of MakerDAO. However, we trust the proposers will conduct their activities in good faith as stewards of the whole (since they are currently separately engaged in other trusted roles within the ecosystem). All should understand that to the extent there is not an adequate structural, legal or practical distinction between what Phoenix Labs operators are doing and the Core of MakerDAO, there may be no good enforcement mechanism or governance mechanism at this time to manage the conflicts of interest or other issues that may arise. Decrease the RETH-A Dust Parameter - March 6, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Reasoning: We are consistent in voting no on lowering Dust Parameters due to the risk it may be perceived externally as targeting retail users in the absence of the larger comprehensive strategy and risk management implementation to be developed through the Endgame Constitution Scope Frameworks. content.content: Executive Proposals  POSTED MAR 10 2023  Emergency Parameter Changes - March 11, 2023 Emergency parameter changes to multiple collateral types including Debt Ceiling, Target Borrow Rate, Target Available Debt, and PSM tin and tout changes. (Maker Governance - Proposal Emergency Parameter Changes - March 11, 2023) SUPPORTED Excellent set of changes proposed here by our outstanding contributors. The confidence market participants have in DAI will be greatly bolstered by these wise and swift actions enabled by superlative governance policies and procedures. But any system (even a decentralized one based on smart contracts) is only as good as the people who take care to perform their unique and individual functions well. Thank you all, each individual who goes above and beyond every day. We expect there will be no U.S. Federal Government bail out of Silicon Valley Bank (or buyers) and this industry will be further hit with regulatory enforcement actions from U.S. agencies that will worsen the current situation. We expect SEC will move against Circle and USDC on the back of this weekend’s spectacle. Signature is in trouble as well and at a minimum Signet is likely to be permanently suspended. As the contagion spreads, expect politics (including geo-political dynamics from a U.S. perspective) to be a defining force for what happens next and to whom. There will be no bailouts, but bail-ins. Godspeed to all. We are confident MakerDAO can and will weather this!

content.content: Executive Proposals POSTED MAR 13 2023  Emergency PSM Changes - March 14, 2023 Introduces a Debt Ceiling Breaker, a new exception to GSM delay, which can instantly disable further borrowing from individual ilks once an executive vote has passed. (Maker Governance - Proposal Emergency PSM Changes - March 14, 2023) SUPPORTED We were correct in our assessment over the weekend. The euphoria and backslapping in the crypto community that occurred on the basis of a couple of U.S. government press releases and accompanying “measures” was entirely misplaced. Without going into a detailed analysis here and now about the bail-in and depositor “support” measures, the risk environment MakerDAO exists in today continues to deteriorate. Situation Room high alert mode should be sustained and this change is a wise measure of our own.

content.content: Executive Summary Pertaining to All the Votes We support evolving and upgrading MakerDAO per the Endgame Constitution. We understand that the approval of the Constitutional MIP set will override and make obsolete many of the MIPs included in this set of polls. For the existing workforce business-as-usual MIPs we have approved the highest budget requests and otherwise defaulted to trusting these teams’ assessment of their needs given their track record in the community, and recognizing the instability and stress of the even greater uncertainty they will be facing if the Constitution vote fails. We are very pleased to support the proposals that appointment specific Facilitators who have already served the project so excellently, and technical adjustments made for teams using business entities. Our consistent view this quarter with respect to new business has been to defer those approvals until the Endgame pregame structure has been ratified and its better way of doing all the things can be implemented. In the event of the Constitution vote failing, the project will be in an even worse place to have already approved the new business initiatives being proposed during this transition. We provide some additional color on specific votes below where relevant. Ratification Poll for the Constitution MIP Set - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes We look forward to the Endgame Era and hope this vote ends with an overwhelming majority of available MKR expressing support. We first become open to more actively engage in the Endgame planning in January after the successful Endgame Prelaunch vote last year, which we did not support. Once the first draft of the Constitution was posted we were encouraged and even excited about what was possible through its upgrade of the MakerDAO purpose, form and function. We have expressed interest in seeing a Regenerative Finance CVC along the lines proposed by ACRE DAOs @goodnews created during the pregame. Kianga @DaveringtonPLLC recently joined an Endgame Decentralized Vote Committee meeting to talk about the evolution of our views and why we see so much promise in the new direction. We are convinced this is the gwei and will be in the best interest of all stakeholders, including and most importantly DAI holders present and future.      Ratification Poll for Onboarding Retro as CES-001 Facilitator (MIP41c4-SP40) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs - Spark Lend Launch (SPF) (MIP55c3-SP16) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No While we approved of allocating a small amount of startup expenses that would cover legal review, we do not find the information provided so far nor the timing compelling to approve of the launch. Please refer to comments here and here. 1,666,722 DAI 2nd choice: Approve NewBear budget - 1,368,924 DAI Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget (DECO-001) (MIP40c3-SP89) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Budget Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit DAI Budget 2023-2024 (MIP40c3-SP90) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve BasePlus budget - 904,805 DAI 2nd choice: Approve Base budget - 805,805 DAI Budget Ratification Poll for GovAlpha Core Unit MKR Budget Q2 2023 (MIP40c3-SP91) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Ratification Poll for Modify Risk Core Unit Budget (RISK-001) (MIP40c3-SP92) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve existing budget - 2,760,000 DAI 2nd choice: Approve reduced budget - 2,484,000 DAI Budget Ratification Poll for Modifying Strategic Finance Core Unit Budget, SF-001 (MIP40c3-SP93) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve Base budget - 2,409,015 DAI 2nd choice: Approve Bear budget - 1,981,140 DAI Ratification Poll for Modify Data Insights Core Unit Budget (DIN-001) (MIP40c3-SP96) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve existing budget - 1,080,001 DAI 2nd choice: Approve reduced budget - 972,000.90 DAI Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No While MIP92 passed, we voted against it for our “no new business” reason. Accordingly, if the Constitution MIP vote fails any implementation decisions for MIP92 should be discussed and proposed in light of those new circumstances. Budget Ratification Poll for Modifying Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit Budget (SAS-001) (MIP40c3-SP95) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: 1st choice: Approve existing budget - 1,130,392.56 DAI 2nd choice: Approve reduced budget - 850,950 DAI Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: Yes Realizing income to the greatest extent possible at all times should be a high priority to mitigate the vast and significant exposure MakerDAO has to counterparty risk, legal risk, credit risk… all the complications of bridging DeFi with legacy financial structures means expenses and time should be taken to regularly verify structures work as intended and maximize the physical control of governance. Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No Remove the DC-IAM from MIP65 (RWA007-A) - March 13, 2023 (thread) Voted: No While MIP65 is not a new business proposal, the magnitude of increase during this interim period before pregame processes are in place raises the same concerns about adequacy of oversight and alignment with a coherent and agreed overall strategy that allocates across all available opportunities. We do not have sufficient information to form a view nor have we seen explicit discussion that makes the case in favor of this increase or removal of DC-IAM, either as a response to recent market turmoil or more generally in the absence of the Constitution MIPs failure.

content.content: Key Info Delegate Address: 0xB4b82978FCe6d26A22deA7E653Bb9ce8e14f8056 Delegate Platform: Coldiron.eth Delegate Platform Forum: @coldiron.eth Twitter: - Discord: please contact our advisor schuppi#6905 Email: [email protected] Meet Your Delegate Video: Meet Your Delegate | Ep. 5 Ft. UltraSchuppi - YouTube  Delegate Statement  Growth over Profit Despite already being considered as a blue chip in the DeFi-ecosystem, we believe Maker is still super early in the game and we should absolutely focus on growing our footprint instead of being profitable.  Decentralization We are far away from being decentralized. That’s okay. Just to give you some idea how we feel where we should go to  Multiple Core Units caring about the same domain is desirable. Just having one Growth CU is not where we should be on the long run, same for CUs doing engineering (we are a lot better already here, but also far from perfect) We need a lot more collateral types. We already overdid this with crypoassets (onboarded collateral which was just not worth the effort/cost), but we think there are a lot of RWA we can onboard on the on the long run There has been some talking about SEC-compliance and other US-focused regulatory stuff. we are totally not saying that is bad, but we are missing the notion of Maker being a trans-national thing. Delegation helped us a lot on letting execs pass. But it also revealed that a single delegate/whale can flip any vote. We need more voter participation and for that most probably a lot more delegates to make this happen.   Trust We are usually trusting in people, and not caring a lot about KPIs. We know that this is bad, but it worked well enough for us. We think we do need some standardized way on how we go with accounting, budgets and all of that. Probably not urgent now, but if we don’t prepare it will be too late at some point and everything will be a total mess. We already see traces here.  About us We are a group of MKR holders who prefer to stay unknown. We have been following @ultraschuppi for more than a year now and believe we can help the protocol by serving as a Recognized Delegate especially because we are not traceable. As for all human interactions a real human is needed, we are going to have @ultraschuppi as an advisor to our platform, empowered with interacting with all other parts of the DAO. Onchain activity will be done by us. In general, we will go with the advice we get from him. As a rule of thumb: We will vote in favor for every exec that gets promoted on chain by the Governance Facilitators that does not feel dangerous to the protocol even if that exec contains changes that we voted against in the previous onchain poll.  Conflicts of Interest We hold positions on several DeFi projects, but not to the same degree as we hold MKR. We are not participating in any other DAO and do not plan to do that. We have read and agree to the Delegate Code of Conduct.  Waiver of liability By delegating to us, you acknowledge and agree that we participate on a best efforts basis and will not be liable for any form of damages related to my participation in the Maker Protocol or MakerDAO.  Edits   2021-11-07T23:00:00Z: added ENS-Delegation to conflicts of Interest  2021-12-12T23:00:00Z: changed ENS name for delegate contract, added twitter, removed RocketChat, added Meet your delegate-link    2022-07-13T22:00:00Z: updated to new delegate contract, removed section about 2nd delegate contract (no one ever delegated to it, pointless to recreate - it will expire in some days)  2023-01-20T23:00:00Z: platform taken over from @ultraschuppi + update

The post includes information on how to contact the delegate platform and a link to a Meet Your Delegate video. GUNIV3DAIUSDC-A Parameter Adjustments (thread) voted Yes Allowing more leverage is good, even if it comes with a lower SF. But I think we should make stablecoin<->DAI-conversation is cheap as possible anyway (remember: we are not making any more money with the PSMs starting tomorrow). content.content: Active Polls  Ending 2021-11-21T23:00:00Z   Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, RWF-001 (MIP40c3-SP39) (thread) voted Yes This is just an unmodified renewal of the currently running budget for the RWF Core Unit. The team has delivered in 2021 and I am very much looking forward to 2022.  Ratification Poll for Real-World Finance Core Unit MKR Compensation, RWF-001 (thread) voted Yes A vesting plan for one of the oldest Core Units was overdue. The proposal is a reasonable vesting plan, no objections.  Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, MKT-001 (MIP40c3-SP33) (thread) voted Yes Like almost all Core Units - this team is under budget. It got some headwinds in the last MIP cycle. Let’s move on.  Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget, COM-001 (MIP40c3-SP40)  (thread) voted Yes Essentially a renewal of the currently running budget. No surprises. I think we should get a standardized and mandatory system in place (reference) - this would not only help the teams to focus on their core competencies but also increase visibility for all stakeholders.  Ratification Poll for Supplement to Collateral Onboarding Application (MIP6c3-SP1) (thread) votes Yes The collateral onboarding process is not ideal in general, but it is great that we get something new for RWA now. I expect more iterations on it in the future, but this is a good start for sure.  Ratification Poll for Adding Sidestream Auction Services Core Unit, SAS-001 (thread) voted Yes This Core Unit has a meaningful mission and a capable team for executing it. The only thing that I do not like is the retroactive vesting - I know this is not the first time and @wouter made some good points why we should do that. There need to be good reasons when this is applied but my subjective assessment is aligned with the procedure here.  Ratification Poll for the Immunefi Security Core Unit (IS-001) (thread) voted Yes A great addition to our existing Core Unit stack and I am really happy to have @psychonaut as Deputy Facilitator in here as well.  Ratification Poll for Adding the Deco Fixed Rate Core Unit (DECO-001) (thread) voted Yes This Core Unit application has been the cause of some sleepless nights and making a decision on it has been the hardest tasks as a new delegate so far. I have been talking with a lot of people from the community, from existing Core Units and from the Deco team. The discussions, opinions and assessments on this application are wide-ranging and frankly speaking: If I would be just a casual voter, I would probably just abstain. I don’t want to go too much into details, but highlight just two points that bring me to the conclusion to support this:  We are onboarding a really skilled team with a unique background - this is a great opportunity for us to evolve. It is not only about the skills they have but also about the nice side effect of unlocking the Project Sandbox (will link to the summary of @SES-Core-Unit  once it is live) Yes, there are uncertainties about the legal and regulatory implications - but again: we are not modifying the protocol here - we just onboard a great team that will take care of dealing with this as well. This is a unique opportunity - you might think of a high-risk high-reward situation - and we should not miss it.

content.content: Active Polls  Ending 2021-11-24T23:00:00Z   Add a GUSD Peg Stability Module (thread) voted Yes I think it is good to have a third PSM in the mix. tin and tout are currently set to zero, so this is not about income. But like the D3M, this is not about revenue, this is about making a strong message to the userbase. A GUSD-PSM will support this.  Add WBTC-C as a new Vault Type (thread) voted Yes ETH-C has been a nice addition to our portfolio, I expect the same to happen with WBTC-C as well. I believe the trade-off of having fewer income by a lower Stability Fee is getting to get offset by having a lower risk on our side in case of a large market downturn and we are potentially also attracting different and more users to this product.  Increase the Aave D3M Maximum Debt Ceiling (thread) voted Yes I would like to see the D3M in a position to enforce a maximum variable borrow rate as soon as possible. For that, we will need a lot higher DC than suggested with this poll. However I am fully trusting @Derek and his team to go with the appropriate speed.  Increase the System Surplus Buffer  (thread) voted  Option 3: Increase the System Surplus Buffer from 60 million DAI to 90 million DAI, with a gradual increase of 1 million DAI per week. Option 4: Increase the System Surplus Buffer from 60 million DAI to 130 million DAI, with a gradual increase of 1 million DAI per week. Option 1: Increase the System Surplus Buffer from 60 million DAI to 90 million DAI, with a gradual increase of 0.67 million DAI per week. Option 2: Increase the System Surplus Buffer from 60 million DAI to 130 million DAI, with a gradual increase of 0.67 million DAI per week.  My primary goal here is to get the SB increased as quick as possible. Going with the 1 MM/week option leaves more than 60% of the profit for MKR burning. Having a higher SB will not only protect us better in case of a crash, but will also allow us to do more experiments (e.g. with RWAs and higher DCs on them). You may find it strange that I favour the 90 MM option over the 130 MM options - I simply think that we will need to revisit our strategy around increasing the Surplus Buffer short term anyway, so i would rather make a commitment on a shorter timespan. There were some concerns about the flap-Keeper ecosystem not being in a good shape, but haven’t seen a single auction since we restarted burning that was not running good. It does not take much to keep it alive, we can be safer by just continously burning a bit - but even some months of not burning has not hurt the ecosystem much.  Ending 2021-11-28T23:00:00Z   Community Greenlight Poll - SB-frOGI (SolidBlock Red Frog Digital Coin) (thread) voted Abstain I honestly have no opinion here, and I am looking forward to have a better greenlight procedure for RWA in the future as outlined in here.  Community Greenlight Poll - MONETALIS (Monetalis Wholesale SME Green Growth Lending) (thread) voted Yes Looks like a nice opportunity to get more DAI from RWA and also fits nicely to the Green Money idea.

content.content: Supported new executive. New teams, new vault types, more headroom for D3M - perfect next step for MakerDao. Let’s move!

Active Polls  Ending 2021-12-01T23:00:00Z   Increase the Dust Parameter for Most Vault Types  (thread) and Increase the Dust Parameter for ETH-B Vault Type (thread) voted Yes Few remember the times we had a dust of 20 DAI. I am really sad we need to make these adjustments, but they are necessary given the current gas-prices. We need to be prepared for liquidating vaults, it is just not avoidable to make these changes. I hope we can be more open once we allow minting on L2s.  Use the MakerDAO Treasury to Fund MKR Expenses (thread) voted Yes As long as we have MKR in our treasury it just does not make sense to mint some for MKR vesting. Even if we cannot agree on burning some of it or putting it to work, we have this option to use it.  Add GUNIV3DAIUSDC2-A as a new Vault Type (thread) voted Yes The proposed stability fees are unlikely going to attract users of this vault-type, but we can adjust them later. The first version of integrating the GUNI-product into our stack was already a huge success though not in terms of revenue. I hope we can tweak the parameters, as this is a nice way helping to keep the peg.  One Time Payment to the GovComms CU to Deal with Budget Issues (thread) voted Yes Another good example why we would be better off with an accounting CU keeping track of those things. But You can’t make an omelette without breaking eggs - let’s move on.  Parameter Changes Proposal - MakerDAO Open Market Committee (thead) voted Yes The proposed changes by MOMC are reasonable - both in terms of balancing growth and profit, but also in terms of trying to break even vault-types with their oracle costs. I would like to see a lower bar and higher debt-ceiling for D3M mid-term so we can grow the footprint of DAI in DeFi and also making some profit out of it.  Add CurveLP-stETH-ETH as a new Vault Type (thread) voted Yes I am really happy to see another staked ETH product appear in our portfolio. Let’s hope it gets enough traction for covering the oracle costs, but you have to spend money to make money.

content.content: Active Polls  Ending 2022-01-12T23:00:00Z   Prioritize Onboarding a Compound DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) (thread) voted Yes We have barely seen a fully exhausted AAVE-D3M yet, but I am a huge supporter of this tool to provide low and stable borrowing rates on DAI to secondary markets and by that increasing the DAI footprint. Extending this tool to Compound is a logical next step.  Raise the Emergency Shutdown Module (ESM) Threshold (thread) voted Yes Most of the MKR is not locked in our voting contract and the current ESM Threshold is just barely above the liquidity in Aave, Sushi, UniV2 combined. It should be a lot more difficult for a bad actor to shut down the protocol. Raising the threshold to 100k is a step in the right direction.  Prioritize DAI Direct Deposit Module (D3M) for Maple Finance (thread) voted Yes Depending on further investigations and details provided by @Growth-Core-Unit and @Real-World-Finance this could evolve in a great way of providing DAI to the markets. Note we are not voting here on any parameters yet, this is just to test the water if the community is supporting this initiative.  Increase the Dust Parameter for Select LP Token Vaults (thread) voted Yes Increasing the dust is always a sad move at it excludes even more users from the protocol. But given the current gas-prices, it is also not economically sound for participants to join the game without being able to provide the necessary amount of collateral anyway. Still hoping for L2   Proposal - Recover DAI Locked in Optimism Escrow  (thread) voted Abstain I don’t like us to perform a special treatment just because the victim is well connected and the amount of DAI is especially huge. Some kind of seed-funding of a MIP taking care of those situations would be a nice compensation in this case. On the other hand: it would not be reasonable to ask the victim to wait some months until a MIP is done and ratified, and this is about 10 MM DAI not usable on Optimism.

content.content: Thanks so much for the feedback! I’m Scarlet Chen, CEO of Robinland. As you mentioned, we’re in the process of the community greenlight poll about our MIP6 proposal here. We saw that you have some questions/concerns so would like to reach out proactively to see if there’s anything we might be able to answer. Robinland channels liquidity from Defi lenders like Maker to fund real estate development projects for a better physical world. Our team consists of real estate industry veteran, crypto native coder, and lawyer familiar with the legal process underneath a security token offering (STO, only process the SEC approves of to issue on-chain crypto tokens that represents real world asset). We tokenize real estate debt projects via security token issuance, and pledge the tokens with Maker to access financing. The projects are all first lien projects w/ full recourse rights, from developers w/ A ratings in NYC. Compared to other proposals (some already approved) on the forum, our advantage is: (1) there is no retail investor involved in any stage, which mitigates compliance risk for Maker (2) there is no utility token or NFT involved in our process, only security tokens, which ensures 100% compliance w/ current SEC rules about securitization (3) we have in-house lawyers familiar w/ the STO process, and our COO has structured Reg D and Reg A fund in her previous career, which are the same underlying process of how we onboard a debt project at Robinland. As for track record: (1) our COO has been in the real estate industry for 7 years and (2) our lawyer has been in practice for 10 years on the same legal process (3) our real estate projects are supplied by Crowdfunz, a real estate PE w/ 5 years track record, 0 default rate, and 10-20 projects financed every year. This is all reflected in the proposal we put together - We talked to one of the senior members of the governance community, and he said ‘this is far more superior than anything I’ve seen on the forum; lots of concerns have been addressed ex ante, like providing Maker w/ a put option’. We’ve spent a long time & lots of thoughts putting together the proposal, read most of the proposals on our forum of similar nature, talked to 5+ lawyers about our structure, and also one of the major members of the Maker governance to get feedback. We truly believe that we’re bringing a better alternative to both parties (supply of projects and supply of liquidity) in this ecosystem! We noticed that a large fraction of the community has voted ‘abstain’, and one delegate voted ‘no’, which is why we’re proactively reaching out. We’re happy to respond to any feedback/criticism the community and/or you might have, as we believe we have the capacity to change our proposal in a way that accommodates Maker’s needs. My apologies for the intrusion if any! And we’re here to answer any question you might have. Many thanks for your time and we really appreciate it!

content.content: Active Polls  Ending 2022-02-09T23:00:00Z   Offloading TUSD-A  (thread) voted  1st choice: Activate Liquidations  2nd choice: Offload to a new TUSD-PSM with 0 Debt Ceiling   We have some unfinished business with the offboarding of TUSD-A. After waiting one year for this thing to work out we need to realize it is not going to happen (almost all vaults are undercollateralized) and we should do something about it. Even if we start again with TUSD as collateral in the future, it is best if we get this cleared. I believe the best way to achieve this is to just activate Liquidations and let keepers do it for us. Adding a dedicated PSM is just adding more work on @Protocol-Engineering - and they have bigger fish to fry.  Introduce Rate Limiting into the Flapper (thread) voted Yes We have been stopping the MKR burn as a urgency exec and this has created a vivid discussion about the pros and cons of keeping the partial burning VS not doing so. I have to admit I am not super convinced that the partial burning we had before this event was the right thing to do - but we should not use an urgency situation as an excuse to stop burning entirely. The Rate Limiter is a reasonable investment even if we decide to move ahead with a different Flap-strategy midterm - but it is mandatory if we want to keep the strategy we had before the urgency exec. In my discussions with @Derek I got the impression it is a reasonable investment from the engineering-capacity perspective as well.  Extend the Delegate Compensation Trial (thread) voted Abstain Needed to think about this a bit, but returning to the same state as before: this needs to pass without me supporting it. MIP61 is in discussion for some months now - I don’t think it is a big issue it hasn’t been submitted so far. But of course it would bring some more certainty - but this is a 1st world problem I guess

content.content: Arrrrr!  Active Polls  Ending 2022-03-27T22:00:00Z   Ratification Poll for Modify Core Unit Budget - Real-World Finance (RWF-001) (MIP40c3-SP61) (thread) voted Yes This has been quite a long time for consideration on my side and I have been opposing this huge increase on the expenses for a couple of days. But eventually, I decided to support this budget after a call I had with @williamr If we want to go into RWAs, we shouldn’t do that half-hearted. Yes, it breaks my heart we need to put up that much money to onboard RWAs onto our stack - but the alternative is to stop our activities and let others do the job. We are still in an early stage here, and we need to spend money if we want to make money here. Yep, this is still a bet that onboarding RWAs helps scaling DAI - but eventually it is a bet I am willing to make - not only as a delegate but also as a MKR holder. This little thing needs to learn flying, but if we don’t fund the wings we should better tear it down entirely. I am not ready for that yet.  Ratification Poll for Recognized Delegate Compensation (MIP61) (thread) voted Abstain There is really nothing I can add to the reasoning of @MakerMan on his delegation-platform:    MakerMan delegate platform   To be clear I support MakerDAO delegate compensation even if I wasn’t a delegate. I believe the work done by delegates is needed and in fact compensation is still too low for the work many delegates do. I would have switched from Abstain to Yes to pass this, BUT I believe when it comes to conflict of interest voting such as this proposal it is the IOU/MKR holders that need to vote and decide these polls NOT delegates. My intention is to abstain from these kinds of conflict of interest votes in the future because I believe delegates should not be put into conflict of interest positions. Point of note here I am still waiting for a polling mechanism to be created that uses some form of snapshot so we can determine if MKR voting is a cost issue or not. We could use this snapshot to poll MKR holders directly on conflict of interest issues for ALL delegate issues.   Truth is: there is not a lot of MKR in the voting contract that is not delegated to recognized delegates - so it will be hard in the future to get stuff like this done without recognized delegates supporting it. So: thanks a lot to @monet-supply @ACREinvest and @GFXlabs for taking one for the team

content.content: Active Polls  Ending 2022-03-30T22:00:00Z   Short Ratification Poll for SPF ETHAmsterdam Event (MIP55c3-SP3)  (thread) voted Yes I have been at the party at EthDenver and observed the “Maker is cool again” sentiment the days later. We need more of that. We have been underestimating the importance of brand building and this event will help.  Initial Parameters for StarkNet Simple DAI Bridge (thread) votes Yes Excited to see we are making more steps forward into L2-territory. 5MM DC is a reasonable first setting.  Short Ratification Poll for MIP62 Amendments (MIP4c3-SP2) (thread) voted Yes As we have offboarded MKT-001 the Collateral Offboarding Process needs to be updated.  Investigate Implementation of a Notional Finance D3M (thread) voted No While this looks like a Declaration of Intent the poll explicitly asks “whether a Notional Finance D3M should be prioritized for inclusion in the Maker Protocol by the Core Units and Domain Teams.” There are two reasons I vote against:  I personally would not put any DAI into Notional Finance - so why would I force our CUs to make a plan doing that? this is clearly a step of micromanaging our CoreUnits. We should stop doing that.  If adding a D3M on Notional would make sense it would have been pretty easy to move ahead with this initiative by collaborating with the relevant CoreUnits on the idea and bringing up a joint proposal to the community asking if we want that or not. I am absolutely  not objecting on getting approval from the community on initiatives like this, but reading the comments on the thread clearly shows this is premature. Instead the procedure looks like we are trying to enforce a direction. I really don’t like that, this is not the modus operandi I envision for us. We should avoid micromanaging on tasks and solutions and rather prioritize on objectives and goals. Oh and yes, having a rather inactive MKR holder suddenly showing up for the onchain poll is not giving me a better feeling about this topic.  Personal Note I and my youngest kid just got tested positive on covid - I guess this is going to affect my whole family over the next days. My availability might be affected. Stay healthy and hydrated all of you!

Mid-term, I really would like to have some tools that makes it easier for the community to compare budget-figures between the different CoreUnits. It is not too much about the additional costs we need to cover, but more about the risk of having an unaligned branding strategy. Ratification Poll for Modify Protocol Engineering Core Unit Budget, PE-001 (MIP40c3-SP68)  (thread) voted Yes I am really happy about seeing the first steps of further increasing the bandwidth by adding more FTE into the core engine team. @Derek is doing a great job leading this CoreUnit and I am confident he will continue delivering with his crew.  Ratification Poll for Add Data Insights Core Unit Budget (MIP40c3-SP64) (thread) voted No I spend some time talking to @tadeo in Amsterdam last week, and I have to admit I am a bit puzzled how we got to this point. There was this comment by @tmierzwa which left me under the impression of this being a “take it or leave it” proposal, and then just a few hours ago another comment him stepping down to allow @tadeo taking over. I am by no means that much of a German to now allow a certain amount of chaos, but… Isn’t this a great opportunity to restart this endeavor by building up the right setup so this CoreUnit is setup for success? Maybe not to the same extend as I already asked the Talent CoreUnit - but surely it makes sense to sit together with the customers of this coreunit (as this is a service-CoreUnit serving other CoreUnits) and agree on the interface and service this CoreUnit will offer in the future? Asking for a budget increase and MKR vesting in the current situation is not the right thing to do.  Ratification Poll for Update Data Insights Core Unit Mandate (MIP39c2-SP31) (thread) voted No same tune as for the budget request: I’d rather see this being built up together with the CoreUnits being served. I personally have doubts about the need for RWA dashboards and analytics - I can´t see how the engineering effort justifies the benefit. But I am for sure wrong, but I’d like to hear that from the domain-owners (RWF in this case).  Ratification Poll for Adding CES-001 as a Collateral Onboarding Domain Team (thread) voted Yes This onboards the whole Collateral Engineering Services Domain Team of CES as a MIP7-Domainteam. Not objecting to this.  Ratification Poll for Modify the Collateral Application Form (MIP6c3-SP2)  (thread) voted Yes Another step forward to improve the collateral onboarding process. Can’t find anything bad about it.  Ratification Poll for Adding Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001)  (thread) voted Yes I did a short trip to EthAmsterdam last week to meet up with some Maker people and to see the second event built by this team. There are just three questions that need to get answered w.r.t. to this Core Unit proposal:  should we invest in Events? does it make sense to have a dedicated group on our payroll instead of just outsourcing this to some agency? is this Core Unit capable of providing this service to the DAO  I think all questions are to be answered with yes:  Conferences like EthDenver and EthAmsterdam are rare opportunities for builders to meet in real life - and for us a great opportunity to build our brand among those people. if you want a consistent event experience it is going to be really hard to find an external partner being able to do that. A MakerParty should have the same look&feel regardless where it is happening. the team around @PonJerry has created an even better atmosphere in Amsterdam - and I already enjoyed the event at Denver pretty much. One can clearly see this team is excited and committed on delivering high-quality events for the DAO.  I agree that we still lack on Brand Startegy (typo intended), but this domain can be clearly handled by this Core Unit. Lezgo! Update on RWA related polls I am certain we need RWA onboarded to our protocol, but it is a domain I have literally zero background in. For the past, I have been relying on input from a lot of other people (also delegates) to make decisions on my vote and while I continue to let myself be influenced / inspired on this particular domain, I decided I will from now on default to abstain from RWA related polls unless  I am overly convinced voting in favour of the poll is necessary and reasonable I am overly convinced I need to help on blocking a poll.  This might be seen as a super weak move, but I think it is just consistent anticipating I have just not enough clue to think of my vote should make a difference. Fortunately, I am confident this is not going to hurt anything, as we are already having a lot of bright minds in the decision making process. Poll Update  Community Greenlight Poll - FEI (Fei USD) (thread) voted No a couple of points why I moved away from supporting this Collateral Onboarding:  FEI as collateral seems only interesting for one party (the FEI protocol itself) - but not generally for others - as only the protocol would be able to mint FEI just to deposit it within our protocol while the intention is the creation of a credit line against FEIs reserve it is not using the reserves, but instead taking the detour of creating FEI which will be taken as collateral - which is creating another risk on our side (not on the FEI protocol) even a 2% SF does not feel like a proper risk-compensation - given the additional collateral risk we have on our side.  Even from FEI perspective it would be more efficient to just borrow against their ETH (ETH-C is running with 0.5%). On the long run, even an IV might be an option (assuming there would be enough DAI demand from it) Adding to what the other Tim said yesterday:    Feedblack Loops LLC Delegate Platform (FBL)   The first thing is: that once collateral gets greenlit, there is little chance to say no, other than one recommendation to keep the debt ceiling low. “It’s only a green light” is incomplete reasoning on my part. Once the foot is in, the pressure is on the CU’s to make deals happen. Which we have to fix as a community. Teams need to be able to say no, both faster and sooner.   I am actually not sure if this is really the case - as I would assume a thorough investigation on the collateral application post-greenlight would have revealed some news that might influence the perspective. But I agree that we in general should be more cautious on what kind of collateral makes sense to be onboarded given the associated risk; where I have nothing but a gut feeling right now - but 2MM/y seems not like a proper tradeoff. I absolutely do not oppose to the idea to collaborate with other protocols - FEI included - but adding the competing stablecoin (which is off-peg a bit right now) as a collateral is not the first step.

Polls update  Deploy a Trial Permissionless Open Market Operation (thread) voted Yes I have been anti-burn/burn-skeptic for most of the last year. The recent market downturn moved the MKR price into a range where I believe we are highly undervalued. I do not believe buying 3MM DAI worth of MKR tokens are going to make a real difference on the price short term, but I think it is useful to pile up more of that cheap MKR into the DAO hands for future use. Of course this is adding another topic into the queue of @Protocol-Engineering  and they already have plenty of high-priority topics on their TODO-list - but after talking to @Derek I am convinced this is a good investment of resources now. While this is just an experiment with 3MM (and remember: we made around 5MM DAI in the last days just out of liquidation penalties) - this lays the foundation of using this mechanism later on again.  Management of Velodrome Airdrop and veNFT (thread) voted Yes MakerDAO will receive a Velodrom airdrop so we can incentivize pools on this Optimism based AMM. The proposal is about which pools we want to push (DAIOP + DAIUSDC) and what to do with the generated fees (direct them to a DAO owned wallet). There are no downsides on supporting this proposal, so no reason to object.  Add rETH as a new Vault Type (thread) voted Yes Although rETH currently has a market cap too low for us to be comfortable to generate >30MM DAI from it, I believe it is important to onboard this collateral for diversification of staked ETH. The proposal adds a line of 5 MM which is a reasonable first step to start this experiment.
Thank you for voting Yes to rETH vault, the rocket pool community is very optimistic and excited to use it.

I supported the out of schedule executive  for temporary deactivating the D3M for aave. I have to admit the whole market downturn made me rethink the D3M path we have entered and I remembered my original thinking of “other protocols should integrate with maker and not the other way round”. Had some interesting conversations in the last couple of days that will for sure bounce around my head for some more time. Still on vacation, (not) looking forward to return to my desk ;p

The Endgame  Boy, this have been pretty interesting weeks and I feel I have missed a lot while being on vacation. Catching up will for sure take some time next week, but since I am already awake and my family is still sleeping - I decided to write down my current thoughts. Let’s check if my opinions hold up against a better informed schuppi in a couple of days   The Decentralization - Dear Leader drama Tons of voices out there ragging about @rune threatening delegates he will undelegate if they don’t commit to his plan. I don’t get it - what do you all think this is? Some kind of hippie commune? He can do whatever he wants with his MKR - nobody has a special privilege to maintain their delegated MKR. I lost ~50% of the delegated MKR from him yesterday and seriously - I am not having any kind of hard feelings about that. This is the risk you take as a delegate if you don’t diversify. (but for sure I am super relieved I never seriously considered quitting my offchain job and go all-in on Maker) I think it is totally fine and reasonable to delegate to those who support your agenda and undelegate from those who don’t. The only flaw we are seeing here is not about Rune, it is about - aside from very view - other MKR holders not participating in governance - either directly or by delegation. This will not change until we deploy heavy governance-participation incentives (and by that punishing those who don’t). But for now it seems that the vast majority of MKR holders simply do not care. Back in the Autonmous MakerDAO Working Group I brought up that even in a fully decentralized organization it would be highly beneficial to have a CEO on top providing a vision, fostering a plan and having the ability to execute with their workforce. We lack that, and no - I don’t think the current setup of MakerDAO can compensate this. So I am actually happy that Rune stepped up pushing his plan. Everybody is welcome to come up with a different one. There is tons of unused MKR out there that can be used to rally for it. My take on the inactivity is: those MKR holders don’t care and by that are fine with moving ahead with this plan. If you don’t use your voting power, you also lose your right to complain.  A plan! So finally we have it! Someone who is heavily advocating for a long term plan, facilitating discussions and by that generating buyin, and having the power to execute (by having the vast majority of MKR used in governance). That’s great! Lezgo!  …but is this everything? No. There is tons of stuff that needs to be decided and checked on even if we totally focus on the Endgame. We have a running business and my involvement as a delegate is not going to change that much just because we have the Endgame Plan and execute on it. My current view on the Engame Party - for sure I am going to party as soon as we really start making moves into this direction, but I don’t see a reason to join a party - though I am probably more dovish than hawkish. Do I want to help? For sure! MKR holders will decide if my help justifies any delegation or not.

Poll Update  Ratification Poll for Adding a Special Purpose Fund - Makershire Hathaway (MIP55c3-SP4) (thread) voted No (replacing previous Abstain vote) Before going into the reasons why I switched: I still think we need to do something about DAI liquidity. this SPF would have helped. Does not feel too good of being an early supporter of this proposal to now voting against it.  we see a lot of new voters coming in - but quite obviously not because Maker is attractive again, but because rallying VCs seems to be a new thing. Cannot really say a lot against it, code is law and yadayada - but given the proposal faces a lot of concerns from the community I don’t think a 50% majority is sufficient. As this is the current modus operandi, I do my part of enforcing this a bit by voting against it a 5/7 multisig is likely not good enough given we want this SPF manage 10MM DAI. I don’t think we can avoid the multisig-problem as a whole, but we could have a lot more and diverse set of comptrollers checking on it yield farming. I don’t think it is worth the effort. Select a Target Level of rNPI Profitability to Guide Budget Cuts (thread) voted  1st choice: Negative (Minimum 3 years runway at any time) 2nd choice: Break-even (Plus-minus 5%)  While I think a healthy discussions on expenses has started, I think we should not overshoot here. In the current market condition it is better to run net-negative than to cripple our workforce. Thanks @strat-fin-core-unit for facilitating.  Prioritization Sentiment - Technical Resource Deployment (thread) voted  1st choice: Maker Teleport 2nd choice: Compound D3M 3rd choice: DssGate 4th choice: Collateral Onboarding  Initially thought those options do make sense, I don’t do anymore. I guess it would be a lot better to vote on goals instead of micromanaging… Not sure this is helpful for anyone, but anyway: I still hope native L2-DAI-supply will be a game changer, hence Teleport on top spot. Compound D3M was initially ranked at place 1, but since there is not a lot room for utilization in the current market - not so urgent anymore. But it probably does not make a lot of sense to stop this initiative (D3M time will come again), so probably also not good to let anyone downvote it now ;-p Included in the Compound D3M is a more generalistic approach - the initial Aave D3M implementation was tailored for Aave. Another good reason to keep going. DssGate: Important to get this done, as it is a prerequisite for the DECO-integration. Collateral Onboarding: put to the last spot because there is not a lot to onboard. Still want to mention it, because i’d like to see a Maker future where vaults provide the majority of DAI and not PSMs.  Prioritization Sentiment - Collateral Class (thread) voted  1st choice: Core Crypto Collateral 2nd choice: Alternative Ethereum-based Crypto Collateral 3rd choice: Broader Market Demand-Based Solutions 4th choice: Crypto Collateral from Other Chains  This prioritization sentiment poll is even more extreme to the point of micro-decision-making as the other one. My goal would be to satisfy as much of the DAI-demand without using PSMs. Does not really matter which one (of course risk/reward plays a role - which is part of any collateral onboarding process). We have smart people on the payroll that are encouraged to come up with smart initiatives, partnerships.
