Delegate Contract Update My currently used delegate contract will expire in a couple of days. I had the great pleasure and honour to play guinea pig for the @dux-core-unit to be the first delegate testing the migration flow on production - worked like a charm! I updated the platform statement already (changelog)  pointing to the new contract removing the 2nd executive-only contract as nobody was using it  I will continue using both contracts (old one, new one) as long as the old contract is not expired. The new contract is currently listed as a shadow delegate contract, which will change as soon as the new release is on production. Technically it is already possible to move over by  undelegating from the old delegate contract  delegating to the new delegate contract - or delegate to someone else - good opportunity if you realize I am not good enough for your precious MKR ;-p  but you can also just wait until the new release is out of the door and experience the smooth UX the DUX-team has built! I was already a bit nervous and impatient, because I initially wanted at least 4 weeks for the delegators to migrate - but looking back I think the additional waiting time was worth it since the UX is really nice! Kudos @dux-core-unit !
Glad to hear the migration went smoothly

@iammeeoh Fully agree with all your comments—the need for migration (including the on-chain txs) is horrible UX and should have been avoided altogether. As I mentioned in the announcement post published earlier the notion of ‘expiry’ is there for a reason, but could have been solved more elegantly. The involved members from the PE team agreed that there are some ways to improve the UX through better delegate contract design, but this was too late for the currently deployed contracts… We made the decision to focus on the UX in the Voting Portal for now (as a means to minimize the risk of missing the deadline [ie. the first expiring contracts] and minimising dependencies on PE), but later this year we’ll collaborate between PE, DUX and GovAlpha on an improved design for delegate contracts. In short; the need for migration sucks and the associated friction and gas costs even more so. The Voting Portal makes sure that delegators are warned in case they need to migrate—no need for manually keeping track of things. And lastly; this will be all be mitigated through a better delegate contract design (release timeline n/a yet) @ultraschuppi Hope you don’t mind me chiming in here

Poll update  Tactical Re-allocation Process for Budget Adjustments (thread) voted No   The Strategic Finance Core Unit will co-ordinate the budget re-allocation process with Core Unit, MKR holders and Recognized Delegates. Any changes to current Core Unit Budgets will be implemented via an Executive Vote, as the Protocol Engineering Core Unit’s schedule allows.   SFCU should provide tools, best practices, standards for CoreUnits to maneuver in financial territories outside of their original domain of expertise. Smart CUs will adopt most of it and we will eventually see a Darwinian Selection happening at some point - either by CUs making proposals to cut down budgets on their own (to highlight one recent example by @psychonaut), by competing CU proposals (wen XXX-002???) or by offboarding-proposals. This poll needs to be a MIP  (and also resulting budget-cuts!). it is giving too much power to a single CoreUnit that I envisioned as a helping hand for other CoreUnits, not as the CFO-CoreUnit. I am concerned about how we got here.
I had similar concerns and am asking the CU for clarity. The wording in the poll seems to give far broader power to SF than what was suggested in the forum vote and presentation.

Poll Update  PSA: I am having a bad day. For sure influences my written-down reasons - but I can assure you: the actual decisions have been made in a much better mood some days ago    Target Spend Level (thread) voted  1st option: No change 2nd option: 17.5 million DAI 3rd option: 17 million DAI 4th option: 16.5 million DAI 5th option: 16 million DAI 6th option: 15.5 million DAI 7th option: 15 million DAI  Probably I am too much of an enfant terrible, but my view of reducing our costs is a bit different. In a pretty abstract view, the existing budgets of our Coreunits are all different when it comes to “how much wiggle room do we have here for cutting the expenses”. Given the lack of clear KPIs, objectives, comparability and what not (management tools) the only way to find out if we have enough bang for the buck is by  looking at the output/outcomes (agreed: pretty subjective) how much budget gets burned anecdotal situations like  bad: MKR-vesting repricing requests good: proactive ideas on how to reduce their burn    which either helps them staying afloat, under the radar, increasing their credibility or destroying it. Sounds bad? Oh yes, it is! Bottom line: I am not convinced a Target Spend Level is going to decrease the level of badness on this matter. But I am happy to learn I was all wrong about it. ultraschuppi:  This reallocates already approved funds from the CES budget to keep working on MIP65. I still find it interesting that we are also going to see a SPF aiming at a pretty similar thing hitting onchain voting a couple of days later, but that’s just how bureaucrazy works I guess    In the chaos of organizing to work through RWA collateral, a solution was found where SF would drive legal work on MIP65 and Backed Finance. Robert’s request went to chain faster despite being posted later because of emergency facilitator powers allowing it to. Details on the solution here. It’s confusing because it’s all chaotic but we are figuring it out slowly. This will all come in a budget-neutral way to the DAO as funds spent through the SPF will not be spent in RWF nor in CES. Ratification Poll for Amend Measurement Period For Delegate Participation Metrics (MIP4c2-SP24) (thread) voted Yes A lean fix for the problem stated here.  If the new Delegation MIP Set does not get proper support,  this will certainly help. Thanks @PaperImperium for this improvement!  Ratification Poll for the MakerDAO Delegates MIP Set (thread) voted Yes Yes, it feels weird doing anything else than abstaining on this poll. But I think this is great step forward. To highlight some points:  the participation metrics are tightened - though I have to admit I think 72h reaction time on executives is still too long. Having them valued x5 against polls is also important - we should be able to quickly pass executives. Not because it is important all the time, but it will be important for urgency executives at some point (we already had that) opening up the delegation ceiling up to 30k MKR is a great way to attract power-delegates (I won’t be one of them, don’t worry). The corresponding compensation allows for teams instead of individuals to do the job - this will bring a whole different quality. MKR vesting - it is pretty obvious that delegates should have long term incentives for the protocol to stay healthy and grow. I especially like the long(er) lockup times; something I would like to see also other contributor compensation models. Imho it could be a lot longer (up to a couple of years).  thanks @Patrick_J for driving this!

Poll update  Ratification Poll for Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit - SH-001 (MIP39c3-SP3) (thread) voted No @aburban90 is not the naturally born CoreUnit facilitator, we probably all agree. Transparency of activities and spending are lacking. But there are few individuals as married to the protocol and its community as he is. He is Maker every minute of his day. Poll Update  DAI Savings Rate Adjustment (thread) voted  1st choice: Increase the DSR to 1%  2nd choice: Increase the DSR to 0.75%  3rd choice: Increase the DSR to 0.5%  4th choice: Increase the DSR to 0.25%  5th choice: Leave the DSR unchanged at 0.01%   The DSR is a huge but so far unused feature that we can offer to make DAI preferred over centralized stablecoins like USDC. Of course we would need to adjust Stability Fees if this works out, but I am willing to go this path. I hope that 1% is already making a difference (despite comparable real world rates are even higher), which is why I put that to the highest position.  PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal (thread) voted Yes While most of the proposed changes look more like housekeeping changes to adjust to the current utilization of the ilks, some changes are pretty noteworthy:   WSTETH-A is getting a lot of traction, doubling the line while at the same time lowering the gap  offers both more utilization while reducing tail risk - those changes will also apply to the lower-risk-sibling WSTETH-B   WBTC-A, WBTC-B and WBTC-C are getting their line reduced by a lot - but even more important: proposed changes to gap and ttl will reduce tail-risks by 90%  GUNIV3DAIUSDC1-A and GUNIV3DAIUSDC2-A will get their line reduced below their current utilization. PSMs   USDP: as there is really nothing we can do with it, it makes sense to increase the tin to encourage utilization in more valueable positions for the protocol  GUSD: it just took a month to suck up almost 0.5B GUSD into the PSM, which allows us apply a small tin and also reduce the tout a bit     Undertake Necessary Risk and Legal Assessments to Increase the NS-DROP Debt Ceiling to 50 Million DAI (thread, original request) voted Yes Despite my usual abstaining on RWA-related topics, I have to admit I am really happy that our engagement with New Silver has been so successful that even the originator @prankstr25 has not only asked to increase the Debt Ceiling, but also proposed an increase on the Stability Fee!
Thank you for your vote of confidence, we will continue to work hard and uphold our strong relationship with the DAO.

Change of Delegate Platform Ever since I started being a solo Recognized delegate, and identifiable as a person, I had two major concerns:   5 dollar wrench attacks - a malicious actor can threaten me, my family or my friends and force me to vote on polls in a unfavorable way or even support bad spells  legal implications - I have no idea (and also don’t want to worry) about any kind of legal or regulatory enforcement that might come along with the current setup  Around the time of EthBarcelona 2022 I met a group of MKR holders that have been following my activities as a delegate, have been supporting my decisions and would like to help me on those two points: They offered to officially take over my delegate platform and use my services as an advisor only for their group and therefore their platform. As the delegate contract is already controlled by a multisig, all that’s needed to effect the changes is to add EOAs of that group onto it - i will still be a signer but not having blocking minority. After adding their EOAs all onchain interactions can be done by them. This group is called coldiron.eth and is not interested in direct participation in the DAO. Instead I will remain active as their advisor, but no longer making the decisions. This change will be made until the end of this month. As soon as the change is done, all further actions and communications will no longer be done by @ultraschuppi, but by a new forum account: @coldiron.eth.

I do not expect a lot of outflow of the GUSD-PSM just because we change this (happy to be wrong though) - but if y’all feel that we took to much exposure, it is a good idea to reduce the barriers for GUSD flowing out of the PSM.  Adjust the GUSD PSM Debt Ceiling (thread) voted   1st option: No change (500 million DAI).  2nd option: Decrease to 100 million DAI.  To be really clear about this: yes, I do feel uncomfortable about the GUSD exposure. But changing the line does not change anything - it is not reducing the amount of GUSD in the PSM. It is a rather symbolic step without having a real effect. If there would be a tangible plan how to really unwind and this would been up for voting, it would have been a different game. But what we see here is just sending a “burn bridges, without having a plan to move forward”. I would like to see “less panic, more plan”. we just supported the current executive spell containing  proposed changes by MOMC (reasons) + reduced AAVE-D3M onboarding MKR vesting for SF-001 (previously approved)  nothing controversial.

Change of multisig For his visit in Denver we decided together with @ultraschuppi to remove him from the multisig controlling the delegate-contract. We have been successfully performing all transactions without any help from him, so there is no need to bear this additional risk.

coldiron.eth:   Ratification Poll for $100M of Cogent Bank Loan Participations (MIP95) (thread) voted Abstain We continue the Abstain-position on RWA-related topics as @ultraschuppi has been doing it already. Poll Update  PPG - Open Market Committee Proposal (thread) voted Yes Increasing the low-SF ilks towards the DSR rate makes a lot of sense. Nice to see the long awaited Compound D3M getting a higher line as well.

Poll Update  Decrease the RETH-A Dust Parameter (thread) voted Yes Bringing rETH-A dust to the same level as ETH-A is reasonable.  Short Ratification Poll for Phoenix Labs Initial Funding (MIP55c3-SP15) (thread) voted Yes This SPF is asking for 50k DAI to pay for the legal and incorporation expenses to bootstrap Phoenix Labs - the company behind the upcoming Spark Lend product. We are excited about this spin-off and hope for a seamless launch in April.

We supported the most recent executive spell containing  tweaking Liquidation Parameters for CRVV1ETHSTETH-A to allow quicker liquidations and a higher throughput (initiated by the Risk Core Unit) increasing the mat for USDC-A, USDP-A, PAXUSD-A to continue the offboarding of these ilks (reasons) proposed ilk changes by MOMC - increasing some SFs and lines (reasons) DAI transfer for GRO-001 (related budget proposal) MKR transfers to TECH-001 (related budget proposal), DECO-001 (related budget proposal), RISK-001 (related budget proposal) Recognized Delegate Compensation (MIP61)  The spells content has been either formally accepted by Maker Governance or fall into the mandate of the Risk Core Unit.

Today we supported the Emergency Parameter Changes to react on the turmoil around USDC and the overall market conditions. Shoutout to @Protocol-Engineering @Risk-Core-Unit and @GovAlpha-Core-Unit  to get this done while we were enjoying a nice BBQ. You are heros! We are not too excited about the GSM-Delay-change, but all other changes make total sense. Moving forward, we all should think about our  (toxic) dependency addiction to centralized assets - maybe it makes sense to move off the hard-peg narrative just to get independent again…

We just supported the most recent spell “Emergency PSM changes” that introduces a LineMom that can reduce lines  to 0. The spell authorizes LineMom to do that on  PSM-USDC-A PSM-PAX-A PSM-GUSD-A  LineMom can do that without respecting the GSM Pause Delay, so it can immediatelly ground a PSM. Thanks again to PECU

Poll Update  Return Excess MIP65 Funds to Surplus Buffer (thread) voted Yes It is a good exercise to do the full roundtrip of the funds deployed to MIP65.  Short Ratification Poll for Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal (MIP92c5-SP1) (thread) voted No Tweaking the parameters feels premature since the solution is not ready to get deployed anyway. This needs some more analysis before we move ahead here  Increase the MIP65 (RWA007-A) Debt Ceiling (thread) voted Yes MIP65 is one of the few solutions we have in place to put the USDC from the PSM to work. We support this idea  PSM Parameter Normalization (thread) voted Option 1 - Diversify Stablecoin Reserves We have seen that fostering a set of of PSMs instead of just relying one is beneficial. For the specific parameters, we would love to see non zero tins as a default on the long run anyway.
